I wanted to like this, but the fit was just too weird. The waist was a bit high and barely buttoned for me, but then the hips were HUGE (and I'm hippy), and because of the material, ballooned out and looked very frumpy. Actually sent this one back without wearing it to work. :/
I loved the idea of this dress. The cut was unique the fabric was heavy and nice. I found there to be too much fabric on the bottom, and it made me look much wider and heavier.
Felt like Mary poppins in this dress. Super cute and fun to wear.

links_reviews_title: Feel great and it made a statement while still bring simple
links_reviews_text: I felt great in it. The actual waist where the first button is does run tight but once you get it accents your small waist. Loved the pockets, love the weight if fabric, I paired it with a black turtleneck and booties and I loved the look. I was concerned about length from other reviews- I'm 5'4 and I thought it was a great length. Longer length but perfect for the season. Only flaw was that I was a little squeezed in at the waist but other felt great in it.

This double breasted dress ran slightly small around the chest and for some reason, the waist line hit me wrong and ended up making my waistline look and definitely made my hips look quite large when worn as a dress. I decided to innovate and wear it as a long vest over a black slim fitting sweater dress. This corrected the style issues I had had when wearing it as a dress. I paired the look with slim suede ankle booties, classic diamond studs, a cartier tank watch, a high topknot and red lips.

links_reviews_title: This was such a great look for a work event!
links_reviews_text: fits great and accentuates my figure in all the right places.
I am 5’8” and the waist was high on me. I’d recommend for anyone 5’7” or shorter. Also, go down a size. Yummy fabric though and love the pockets.

I love the look of this dress but it you have a bit of a belly know you may look pregnant given the button and pleat placement. I've rented this dress twice and worn it 4x and continue to get compliments every time I wear it (dinner, work, church, interviews). Can be dressed up or down based on what you wear underneath and on your feet. Love this rental for cooler weather.
Love this dress. Wore it with a black turtleneck and got lots of compliments. Has nice deep pockets. Perfect for work.

links_reviews_title: Fun option for a conservative workplace
links_reviews_text: This dress has a lot of fabric, but is very cute. I wore a collared blouse under it but I think a turtleneck would work best. It was hard to get the collar to lay correctly with the dress.

links_reviews_title: Loved the tailored top, but the skirt had too much material for my taste. It felt bulky.
links_reviews_text: If you are larger up top, size up!

links_reviews_title: Fit perfectly, flattering, perfect for work.
links_reviews_text: I wore it with black tights and black booties and it worked in the coldest Michigan weather!

links_reviews_title: Great waist but a lot of fabric
links_reviews_text: Long and heavy bottom made it a bit frumpy

It reminds me of a school girl uniform, but that isn't a bad thing. You can really change up the look depending on what shirt you pair under it. I wear a six or eight in dresses. I ordered the eight and it barely fit in the chest, rib cage. There is no give, so if in doubt, size up. The hip area has plenty of room and is flowy. I did feel that because of the pockets it makes you look wider in this area. Since it was fitted in the waist, this didn't bother me. The material is lined and thick and warm. It's polyester, but still feels expensive. The length below the knees makes it feel more conservative and work appropriate. I liked it well enough, but it didn't stand out for me like some other pieces I've rented.
Great fit, bold pattern without being overpowering. Feminine details
Wore for work. Put a sweater over because I was chilly, but I enjoyed the ruffle detail. Wore with Theory pants also from RTR.
I love this. The material is exquisite and so is the cut. It hangs beautifully. The neckline is extra stylish. Love love love!
Fit true to size. Very nice quality fabric. It looked nice tucked in or left out, but I ended up with a half-tuck because my blazer was cropped in the back.
Fits great. I wore with a blazer on top for work
Nice top for work. It is a little loose, so size down if you want a more form-fitting top.
Wore to work with the Parker Pink Bo Blazer. Beautiful quality shirt although it was a little billowy and big at the arms. Will probably rent again in a smaller size.

Fit well, really pretty pale pink color. Didn't realize in the photo that the ruffle is actually an long piece of extra fabric. Wasn't a problem for me but it could get in the way depending on what you're wearing it for

My work environment is pretty conservative but I still push the boundaries in a way that works. This top looked great on its own, but the jacket and culottes (both previous RTR purchases) made it perfectly stylish for my work conference.
I thought this was flattering. I'm normally a 2 and the 0 was very roomy. It's not too sheer so you don't have to wear an undershirt. I am happy.

links_reviews_title: Super Dowdy. Don't get the hype.
links_reviews_text: This shirt was dowdy and unflattering. It's long, with a lot of material waist down due to the ruffle and loose shape. Looked ok tucked into a pencil skirt that was appropriately snug at the waist, but still managed to be unflattering. Might be cuter on someone flatter chested since the ruffles do add some oomph in that area.

This is getting added to me list of regular rentals. Wore it with black formal pants and it looked gorgeous! I love the ruffled tie think down the neck. The size 0 I ordered was a perfect fit everywhere for me - bust, waist and armhole, which doesn't happen as often as I'd like. It sits perfectly on my hips and is the perfect length. Very comfortable material for the summer. Can't wait to order again.

I'd rent this top again. It is perfect for a hot summer work day. I wore it with black pencil skirt and heels. Very cute. I also loved that the buttons were not popping open which some button down shirts do on me.

links_reviews_title: Super cute top for work; very comfortable
links_reviews_text: I really loved this piece. It was really comfortable and super stylish. Made me feel like a million bucks

Perfectly paired with black pants for work. I liked the look and fit, especially with the front ruffle, but it has a hint of pink to it (it's not only white as it appears in the photo). It's also longer in the back, which I liked, but also difficult to tell from the photo.
The material was nice, but it isn't for someone with a large chest. It's really unflattering
Great fit. Slightly low if you don't close the button on the top.
Pretty

links_reviews_title: Cute top for work and weekend
links_reviews_text: Fit large - I sized down. Looked great with black pants for work, and jeans on the weekend. Will rent again.

links_reviews_title: Really comfortable and covers bra straps
links_reviews_text: I am a little busty and it was nice be able to wear a standard bra (no racer back) and not have the straps hanging out. Also, it is interesting enough with the ruffle that it doesn't look as common as other blouses.
Fit was ok. Stain on the shirt. Never wore.
Never wore it. 4 looked super boxy on me. Belts looked weird. Maybe I should've gotten the 2? Material / pattern is nice, but cut wasn't flattering on me.
Great blouse. Fit true to size and looked great. Very professional.
Just enough of a unique twist on a work blouse (the ruffle in the front). Very substantial beautiful silk material with a unique print.
I wear a 6/8 in tops, and the 8 fit perfectly.

Wore it under a waterfall cardigan and found it to be very flattering in this 2nd trimester. NOTE: It looks just white and black in the picture, but there is also blush pink as part of the coloring. Very pretty but worth noting if you thought just white and black.
I liked the pattern and the ruffle - worked well with black pants and boots. I didn't think the material was that nice - definitely not worth the price to purchase!
Flowy top for work, no jewelry needed.
Although I don't think I'd ever pay even the RTR price to buy this blouse it was lovely to wear. Sturdy and silky fabric, and forgiving and flattering in all the right places.
The photos don't show that there is a very subtle pink undertone on the blouse - very lovely. Very well tailored and nice structure.
This blouse felt amazing for a warm day, and it looked fabulous with a pencil skirt. I thought it was true to size and the fabric feels silly/doesn't wrinkle easily

I wanted to REALLY like this shirt but the ruffles were just too much for me. W/o the ruffles it probably would be worth buying. I could see myself wearing this for a long time. It was sooo well made and I felt so classy in it. I even looked at it for a couple minutes to see if the ruffles would be easy to remove. But, alas, you don't spend $200 or however much on a shirt and then remove parts of it. I'd consider renting it again.
Great fabric and fit. Perfect for a conservative work environment.
I wore this twice for work. Once with a blazer and once without. It is a fun pattern and a fun style.
The fit is perfect for my 36C athletic bust but it could be a little less loose around the waist. Overall, wear it with black or white/cream slender pants and it looks killer.

links_reviews_title: basic work shirt, soft material with fun extra details
links_reviews_text: This shirt was very easy to wear. It fit well. Great for the office.

links_reviews_title: Great fabric, well made and very upscale
links_reviews_text: Would love to rent again in a smaller size - the 8 was just a bit too large. Wore with a black tank underneath to have some coverage because it was a bit too roomy in the armhole area. Great gut and the color of the pattern is fantastic.
Great change for summer wardrobe. Runs a tad on the large side but not too crazy. Probably should have ordered a 4 instead of 6.
This top is perfect for work, and stands out in the best way. It is very comfortable and light, and the ruffles give it a fun twist.
Beautiful fabric. Runs a bit large.
Received tons of compliments on this jacket; loved wearing it out!
I had high hopes but this ended up being okay. Doesn't look good with pants, at least on me, agree with one of the earlier review, looks better with short dress.
Great coat but it's navy and white not black and white. Wallet is black for comparison.

I love this coat! Soft, quality, mid-weight fabric that's just slightly thick enough to keep me warm on breezy spring/fall days. The pattern is more buffalo check than gingham and it definitely feels like a city coat. I didn't spot the pearl embellishments on the sleeves until I opened the RTR bag and thought I'd hate them, but they are subtle enough just to add interest. You can dress this up or down and it's a good one for shorter girls who want to try the oversized coat trend without looking like they're drowning in fabric.

I wore this without the belt and loved it. It isn't super warm so it's great for transitional months or with layers underneath. The shape itself is boxy so size down if you want something closer to the body.
Cute coat. Different from anything I have. I liked the pearls details, it looked pretty but I should have order a medium size.

links_reviews_title: Thin fabrics but so eye catching!
links_reviews_text: Very nice over-size coat to instant up your style. It's quite thin not ideal for winter lower than 50F. Material is okay, not luxurious or high-end but I still like the style a lot. The pearls on the sleeves are nice touch.

links_reviews_title: OK but not my favorite rental
links_reviews_text: This was OK but wouldn't rent again. Wore it without the belt because it felt too fussy with belt. It is pretty light and not very structured. Love the look others wore with a black dress so would consider renting again in warmer weather.

links_reviews_title: It's fun and can always change
links_reviews_text: Love this coat - it's not puff as I had imagined - it has big sleeves - love it and wish I could buy it - a little thin so not ideal for winter coat - the navy is amazing - I love it!!!!!
Great way to dress up a boring outfit.

links_reviews_title: This photo shoot was to show my style and the feminine/edgy aspects! It truly represents my style!
links_reviews_text: This jacket is pretty special! The bubble sleeves make it really high fashion, while being able to wear it day/night! The pearl detail gives it that feminine touch, while also being unique and edgy! The fit runs a little large for the sizing but it is an oversized type of fit, so it works!
The pearl on the sleeves made this coat wonderful for work. Loved the fabric and unique pearls on the coat. Looked great with black pants or navy pants.

links_reviews_title: Funky Modern Take on a Blazer
links_reviews_text: I rented this coat because I felt the silhouette was super cool- it definitely it! However, I am an hourglass figure, so this silhouette didn't show as well on me as it would in somebody with less booty/hips. It was a fun change to a typical work blazer though, and the pearled shoulders are the best!

I loved the style of this coat. The pattern is definitely navy and white, not black FYI. I was expecting it to be a much thicker coat but it is more of a light jacket for fall. May rent again in the future when it's warmer out.

links_reviews_title: A cute jackets with pearl details. This is something that I don't normally have in my closest.
links_reviews_text: This is a boxy style jacket, which swallowed my 5'4" frame. It was cute and I did receive compliments on it but I didn't feel "great" in the jacket. I think it would look better on someone that is a little taller. Also, this is NAVY (not black) checked. Would look great with jeans or navy dress pants.

links_reviews_title: This was true to sz with a roomy fit.
links_reviews_text: This was just ok.

links_reviews_title: the pearl detail on the sleeves is absolutely the best
links_reviews_text: This is a great jacket. It is a light flannel type material, not too warm but definitely not a summer weight. My outfit was all RTR. I wore it close to what is shown, with the Cinq a Sept Black Lida Pants and a Nicole Miller black silk blouse. The pearl detail on the sleeves complemented the round button trim on the sides of the pant. The jacket is super comfortable and looks great with slim pants. The only thing that was a little annoying was no closures for the jacket, and using the enclosed tie belt didn't necessarily keep the jacket closed, I had to keep adjusting it. But all in all, an elegant, great jacket.

I rented this because I thought the sleeves were going to be wider and puffy...note that the sleeves are not puffy like pictured. The fabric was also different than what I thought - more of a wooly fabric vs. crisp smooth fabric. Also I didn't realize there were these pearls on the shoulders. Totally missed it from the pictures and wouldn't have rented if I knew. Just not my style

links_reviews_title: It's a very cute jacket, but too lightweight to wear now
links_reviews_text: it's slightly oversized, and chic looking

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this because it was too bulky.
links_reviews_text: The fit is bulky. Too much material.
Lovely, fairly chunky gold necklace.

Incredible heavy weight, expensive looking toggle choker. I own a few pieces from this designer so I thought I'd rent and I was not disappointed! It's pretty substantial and I wore it to a dinner but also to work and to play tennis lol. I purchased! Must rent!
Really solid interesting necklace. I found it a tiny bit small for me but I am taller at 5'9".
Easy to pair

links_reviews_title: A cool and easy everyday piece.
links_reviews_text: I really love this necklace. It looks great stacked or stand alone.
good size/weight
Great chunky chain!
Great length necklace that can be worn with clasp in front or back. Love!!
The style is different. I little quirky but still cute.

I am officially obsessed with these Kooreloo bags. The entire reason I signed up for rent the runway was because my friend told me she rented her Kooreloo (which id never heard of) when I asked where she got her bag. These bags are so high quality and so fun. I am surprised they are only $500 for how great they are. The inside of the bag is also fun and I always get a compliment when opening my purse haha
chanel inspired on the outside, groovy hand painted lady on the inside flap. very groovy and fun. wore it as a crossbody. the chain annoyed me after a while- it was kinda heavy.
I love this bag, it's really cute for fall and the detail on the inside is really cool

This is actually one of my favorite rentals ever. It's SUCH a cool purse. I wore it with the black and gold Slate & Willow dress for a wedding, as well as all my clothes for that weekend. It fit my iPhone 10, a sunglass case, lip gloss, and I put some cards in the little side pocket inside.
Couldn't believe the number of compliments I got on this bag! The inside is a fun surprise - but the outside is so chic. A smidge worn looking - photo has better colors - but still amazing.

links_reviews_title: Adorable bag, lovely color - quality meh
links_reviews_text: So glad I rented this bag. I would have been very upset if I purchased at retail and then saw how easily the hardware fades. I know it was the quality of the bag and nothing to do with RTR. This was a fairly recent arrival to RTR and this bag made the case for my membership to RTR. Try before you buy, rent and then return.

Picked this up in store. Modern clean lines. Pretty color. Loved the perfectly sized pocket on back/outside for easy access to cell. I wish all bags had this feature. Fit all the basics and a couple of extras like a small umbrella. As another reviewer mentioned one compartment has a strong magnetic clasp...bordering on too strong. The other side is open. The paint was chipping off the metal clasps to strap, which wasn't a deal breaker renting, but wouldn't be too happy about it if I purchased it.
The color of this bag makes it easy to pick your outfits. It literally goes with everything. Feels so expensive !!!!

links_reviews_title: Not a commuter bag but can function well for every day.
links_reviews_text: Soft leather. Small but good use of compartments: back pocket, front pocket, 2 inner compartments. Very strong magnets to keep all of your gear in place. Can fit all the essentials. Heavy enough to feel expensive but not enough to be a deal-breaker.
this bag is great! fit so much without bulking! the color goes with everything.

Cute sweater -- got lots of compliments on the nubby texture. I didn't love the poofed-up shoulders, but they elevated the vibe of the piece. If you have sensitive skin, you would probably want to wear a long sleeved top underneath. I styled this with a black s/s scoop neck top, slim black pants, and leopard flats.
I liked it enough to buy! This jacket can be worn so many ways. If there's any negatives it might be slightly itchy but not enough to bother.
I wore this to a work conference and received compliments from so many people. I will definitely rent this again!

Wore multiple times. To work with black dress and with jeans on weekend. Sleeves were a little long so rolled up. Fabric is a nubby sweater like fabric that was warm but not too heavy with shades of maroon and black and mustard. The lapels didn't always lay flat so sometimes the inside was facing out but it didn't really matter. Great jacket.

A colorful and fun blazer that is a little casual. Great when you want to be a little dressy but not over dressed. I liked the texture of the material and the colors are nice. I almost bought it but the end of the season is here.

links_reviews_title: Love! Wore to work on a Friday with jeans & a black tank under - super comfortable, warm & trendy!
links_reviews_text: Casual but trendy. I'm normally a size 4 and the 1 fit great - love the flow and the "grandma" type material / feel (but so trendy!)

links_reviews_title: Perfect piece to make an outfit pop!
links_reviews_text: Fit great, was a little on the warm side, but colors were great!

links_reviews_title: I wore this for a bridal shower. It was pretty and warm
links_reviews_text: It fit great and I got so many compliments on the jacket!

Easy to wear style, comfortable, warm and stylish. This fit my lifestyle so well I wore it three times in one week, to evening meetings and professional gatherings. People I didn't know would stop me to say how cute it was! Almost considered buying it, but it is so memorable, you can't wear it that many times. Only downside is the material is starting to pill, RTR will need to fix that.

I felt that this laid more like a blazer than a cardigan, which was not what I was hoping for. It's very unique and beautiful though. I would recommend wearing long sleeves under this because it's a little itchy.

Loved this piece! I wore it a bunch of times- it went with surprisingly more things than I would have imagined. Fave look was over cranberry velvet leggings and a black tunic for a dinner date with my daughter. Not as itchy as other reviewers mentioned. Definitely recommend sizing down. I'm usually a 4. The 0 fit perfectly.

links_reviews_title: A sweater that makes you stand out at work
links_reviews_text: Cpmfortable and true to size

links_reviews_title: obsessed with this jacket - vibrant, different, flattering
links_reviews_text: Fit me perfectly. Pretty warm. So many compliments. A little itchy at first but didn't notice after a while
I got so many compliments on this jacket and I paired it with my leather skirt #theyaintready
The material felt itchy and the arms are so skinny that it was not not possible to wear anything other than a shell or T-shirt below the jacket.
This sweater/jacket is gorgeous! A bit itchy but got many compliments. So different!
The fit is just right, and it is an incredibly unique item. It makes for a great statement piece, but it does not close and it is not warm.
Might be good for winter but was way too itchy for me to wear. Beautiful otherwise!l, thick knit but doesn’t look a lot like it does in the model’s picture.

links_reviews_title: I never wore it. It was itchy.
links_reviews_text: I never wore it. It was itchy.

links_reviews_title: it was cute - but very warm
links_reviews_text: Definitely better for winter
Went well with a black dress

I didn't love the fit as it make me look a little top heavy and boxy but probably would have worn at least once except I had a short sleeve shirt underneath and it was very itchy on my arms. Ended up not wearing this top.
It's a nice piece that is casual but elevated, but beware - it's itchy!

Fit nicely in the shoulders and the colors were nicer than expected. But, the fabric was too itchy and the folds in front did not lie in flat folds like in the photo. For me they folded over to show the unfinished fabric and were too voluminous for me.
Fabulous upgrade for a presentation. It's thick, so better for winter months.

links_reviews_title: Can dress up or dress casual!
links_reviews_text: I wore this with dark jeans and a thin white turtleneck underneath and it was super cute. I loved this piece, but I will mention that the sleeves were a little tight on my arms
It is super cute and one of a kind- got tons of compliments. It's itchy so you have to wear a long sleeve shirt under it. It is also very warm so wear it during colder months
I got a lot of use out of this piece. It's easy to wear and looks great with everything.
The fabric in quality was beautiful. However it was a little old looking, frumpy for my work event.

links_reviews_title: Cute jacket but not for summer!
links_reviews_text: I ordered this thinking it would be cute to wear over a black shift dress at work. I didn't realize the fabric was more of a sweater/knit/boucle type fabric. It is definitely not made for spring or summer, only winter or fall. It draped beautifully though and will definitely rent it again when it gets cold!

I received lots of compliments on this piece, and wore it a handful of times. It was a lot warmer than I was expecting it to be, so it's definitely best for cooler weather. I didn't have any problems with the fit, and would recommend renting this if you like color!

I liked this jacket but it was tight in the arms which is why I did not give it 5 stars. I wore it over a sleeveless dress and it looked good but the arms were still tight. There was no way I could have worn it with a long sleeve top or dress. Also, it is definitely a fall/winter jacket.
Comfortable, not tight at all.
This was a heavier fabric than I expected but I liked the colors and the style.
Great little sweater to update wardrobe. The pattern is a stand out. If you have sensitive skin I would put something other than a cami underneath. Can be itchy at first.

links_reviews_title: Must be ok with shoulder pads
links_reviews_text: Fun but I wish the shoulder pads were removable. It was hard to make this casual with such a strong silhouette.
GREAT jacket! I wore the heck out of this thing. Good with jeans, over a dress, with black pants, etc. A versatile work-horse. Really considered adding this one to my permanent collection.

links_reviews_title: The fabric was very scratchy on the skin.
links_reviews_text: If you wear sleeveless shells under jackets like I do, this might not be a good jacket for you. The fabric was so scratchy I returned it immediately. The look is a little unusual - my spouse thought it looked like a kitchen rug. If you are young and edgy this is probably a better match for you.

I loved this sweater!! It was SO thick and warm - perfect for a cold rainy day. Only gave 4 stars because it is rather itchy and the sides stick out awkwardly. It was great for a one time wear and I got lots of compliments! Who doesn't love a fun sweater??

links_reviews_title: Bright colors, cozy, and fun to wear once or twice.
links_reviews_text: I really like this POLO sweater! Its heavy fabric made it easy to wear on mild winter days instead of a coat. It's definitely the type of sweater you don't want to wear with a coat on because it looks busy without the POLO on the arm. (Sorry, shallow? Not so sorry.) Pros: - Luxe heavy fabric - Comfy and forgiving Cons: - runs a little large, especially on the sides by the natural waist - you can see in the photo it looks sort of puffed out and I couldn't smooth it down. I wore it twice.

links_reviews_title: Great Sweater When You Need To Stay Warm...
links_reviews_text: Great sweater for Jackson Hole, WY! Super warm and cute. It is a little bulky but not bad especially when you are outside most of the day and the temperature is in the single digits.
This sweater is the best ever made! Warm and just the right length.
Good fit - I like a sweater to have an oversized shape and this did that without me having to size up. Definitely not huge or anything though. Fantastic bright colors.

But I felt like I was wearing an ugly Christmas sweater in real life. It's not itchy and it's heavy and warm, I could go without a coat in 50 degree weather. I'm usually a small and it fit well. It does bunch up around the waist like other reviewers mentioned, so it's not super flattering. I would not rent it again.
Bright colors and chunky fit- not very flattering on me as it bunched over my stomach however much I tried to pull it down
Fits the bill for an ugly sweater party. It is thick, loud and looks super dated.
Rented this for thanksgiving and I loved it. It's a little itchy but it fit great

I love this jacket. It's very square so it doesn't look good with longer items. But I wore it on vacation to go out at night and got so many compliments. Better with lighter clothing items underneath.

This jacket is super cute! Got it for a trip I had to London. I was able to wear it with a sweater underneath and was plenty warm. It was a hit with my friends and got a bunch of compliments on it. This pic was the best one I had sorry! It's semi cropped- I wore it with high waist jeans and it came down to the back pockets.

This is an overall weird fit for me. I have a curvier body, so I always wear medium or large. This I could've worn a small, because the jacket isn't big enough to wear over a sweater, but over a T-shirt, it looks bulky and ill-fitting. I was expecting it to be a cropped jacket and it came to my hip bone and bulged out (given, I'm 5'2 w a short torso). Not my favorite item

links_reviews_title: This jacket is perfect for everyday!
links_reviews_text: I loved this jacket! I paired it with high waisted pants and it was boxy enough to wear a lightweight sweater underneath it. I think it is true to size and would be perfect to wear in the fall.

links_reviews_title: I'm going to buy this jacket
links_reviews_text: This is a perfect Cropped fit Jacket. I already sent it back but I plan on buying it was super versatile and paired with everything

I love this edgy jacket by Free people!Running true to size with no stretch, I recommend wearing your true size for your primary size. At 5'5 1/2, the length hit my waist on me. This style is fitted throughout the midsection.
Versatile and perfect for a colder game day!
Cute, not crazy about it, wore it once

links_reviews_title: Good for a fall day or to wear under another jacket
links_reviews_text: Runs a bit large but I think it's meant to be oversized look. I rented it to wear under my long wool coat and it still made the deal. I loved the colors on it too. Great to pair with something either more formal or casual. Might rent again!

links_reviews_title: Wore this to work and a football game.
links_reviews_text: Cute, warm, great for layering.

links_reviews_title: Loved this casual but great for work, wore with a long maxi skirt was fun but still serious enough
links_reviews_text: Fit great
This is the second time I rented this. The first time I rented a larger size and it was not quite right. Get it snug and it's a super cool plaid jacket with a stylish 1970's groove.

links_reviews_title: Love this jacket! fits perfectly and so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: True to size
I wore this jacket to work. Looked professional without looking boring. It runs large, I usually wear a Small and was glad I ordered XS.

links_reviews_title: I chose the wrong size so I was dwarfed in it
links_reviews_text: This jacket is somewhat cute. I should have ordered a M instead of L but cuffing and pushing up the sleeves helped. I'm a size 8/10 but there must have been something in someone else's review that made me go with L.

links_reviews_title: Fun jacket alternative to a blazer
links_reviews_text: Liked it and it was a fun alternative to a blazer. I wore it with a black Chanel pencil skirt, black riding boots, black tights and a thin black wool role neck sweater from COS. It totally changed the outfit. The only problem was that the sleeves on the upper arm were too tight (but the body of the jacket was actually large). I would have worn it more if the sleeves fit.

links_reviews_title: Super cute jacket, just never ended up wearing it
links_reviews_text: Fit was ok, little small in the arms/wrist area making it hard to wear things underneath
Very cute! very flattering. Would rent again.
Pretty slouchy fit, but the waistband makes it flattering.

links_reviews_title: I wore this jacket several times!
links_reviews_text: I LOVED this jacket! I have long arms and the arms were a little shirt, otherwise, it was so cute!
I read the reviews and thought a large would be the best fit for me. It was too large to wear. Hopefully, I will be able to try it in a medium as it is a very cute jacket.

links_reviews_title: Great material and everything else but the fit is terrible
links_reviews_text: The fit is extremely big - doesn't look good on petite people

links_reviews_title: Great jacket, name says it all -- it's slouchy and retro, and looked great with jeans.
links_reviews_text: I wore a thin shirt underneath and left the jacket on all day (it was a cool day).

links_reviews_title: Runs really big, was never worn
links_reviews_text: I should have known with Free People to size down but the jacket had no shape and was way too big

links_reviews_title: So cute! Could be worn with a lot.
links_reviews_text: I wore this to work and then post-work dinner with a friend. Easy and cute!

Loved this jacket. It was cute and simple and I just wore it with black jeans and either black sneakers or black heeled booties if I wanted to dress it up a little. Word of advise though, this is not a warm jacket. If you plan on being outside in New England this fall this is not the jacket for you. It will not keep you warm.
Fit well
Such a cute jacket for fall. It is a little itchy though but is fine as an outerwear piece!

Size down! It has a boxy look, but if you don't size down it just looks frumpy. I'm normally a S/XS, originally went with the Small but exchanged for the XS. I didn't end up wearing this much because you kind of have to plan your whole outfit around this. But it's cute and great for fall!
The large was too large for me to wear. I probably could have gotten away with a small or medium. I liked the style though.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but I wish I would have sized down
links_reviews_text: The style is cute, but it's big and the fabric is nice, but a little heavy for LA right now. I don't think I am going to wear it

links_reviews_title: Perfect for lounging by the pool
links_reviews_text: Bohemian tunic in softest material and included beautiful touches and details. Full sleeves with ruffles and fun tassels

links_reviews_title: Love this! So comfortable and versatile
links_reviews_text: When I first tried it on I must admit it seemed to swallow my petite frame but the fabric and quality were so beautiful I really wanted to make it work. I realized if I wore it off the shoulders and played with the ties I could really cinch in my waist and make it not so open and revealing at the bust. Absolutely love and plan to wear many times and most likely purchase!

Cute for vacay! I got the large bc that was the only size available but it was fine. Just pulled the sleeves up. It was surprisingly hot with all the fabric though. But I would still recommend for any warm vacay!

I needed a medium but no matter. This mumu was the perfect every day dress on vacation in Hawaii! It went from mornings to pool to beach to misty mountains for lunch with absolutely no issues. The gauzy cotton was both cool enough and warm enough. Loved it
Easy dress to thrown on and look cute and comfy!! Got so many compliments

links_reviews_title: Perfect beach vibes dress but be careful it runs very large. @rtr please give us more dodo bar!!
links_reviews_text: #vacationoutfit
Quality material, it is very loose which I love. Perfect beach cover up. Has cute side cinch ties. I really do love the material. It's a luxurious, fun dress, perfect for a vacation.

links_reviews_title: Couldn't wear because it was very large
links_reviews_text: This dress runs very LARGE. Im a larger size 10 or a small 12. Too big to wear. Cute, but will have to send back.
So cute and fun, but expect to wear as a coverup or with a slip underneath.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and loved the color!
links_reviews_text: Ended up wearing to bbq as the cut in front is very deep and low so it needed more casual with my chest size

Completely unique dress that I really wanted to keep. It's made of the thickest and softest fabric and features a lot of really cool inset details. Incredibly comfortable caftan for late afternoon after being in the sun all day. It does run big so size down. Also, the front bodice was pretty gaping so I had to wear a tank under it. Not a huge thing but plan for it. Fantastic dress a d love this designer!
The fit is very bulky and the fabric is a heavier cotton - like an old woman's nightgown. I had such high hopes for this one!
Large and comfy for the beach pool
No closure at top besides the tie at the neck. Really only can be worn on the beach.
Really cute dress, would probably be better as a swimsuit cover than dress though. Extra roomy, even though I got a size too small. So size down unless you're tall because the length is true to size.

links_reviews_title: Be ready for Little House on the Prairie references
links_reviews_text: I loved this dress. Is it flattering? Not really. Did my SO love it. No. But it was the only thing I wanted to have on in the cool evening after a day at the pool.

links_reviews_title: comfortable, unique, easy breezy! Great for vacation!
links_reviews_text: runs large, but still looks great

links_reviews_title: The arms were too long for me.
links_reviews_text: Arms were to long for me

Dress was very pretty-the details on it were amazing with beautiful stones detail and soft cotton. However, the dress is completely sheer and the fabric is so delicate with loose strings weaves through it that I had to constantly be aware of where I was sitting, rubbing up against, etc. which made wearing it not so fun. If you get this for a beach or pool cover up I would be worried about damage to it. I wanted to love it though for its craftsmanship, but sadly only wore it once. It was also really big, even with the waist ties. Size down.
Fits perfect! If in between sizes though, I'd go up!
Wore this during the day then around to bars. Super cute and fun! However arms were short on me
Super comfy, and a beautiful shade of red! I wore it to an all red event, and as an everyday outfit. It can really pull a whole outfit together
great fit and love the color and would like to keep!
A light windbreaker jacket. Nice pop of color and fit great.
Loved it for a sporty look.
Trendy and easy to style

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it!
links_reviews_text: Was hesitant at first because you know, cape - but I just fell in love with it! Warm enough for Seattle in February with layers but great too for a date night in warmer temps (like 60). Received lots of compliments and felt very stylish. Just couldn't send it back!
Great weight and material. I wore it as an actual coat at a work event and got so many compliments! Would def wear again!

This is a quality piece, heavy and warm. I enjoyed wearing it and received lots of compliments! I normally wear a medium in clothes and jackets but I read other reviews saying it runs large so I got a size small and it was perfect.

links_reviews_title: Felt like a giant grey pancake...
links_reviews_text: This cape is immensely unflattering. I grew up catholic and the first thing I thought when I saw myself in the mirror was how much this circular non-shaped garment looked like priest robes. The arm holes are also located in a really awkward place at the front. This isn't so much a cape as it is a carpet parachute with holes.

I rented this to wear over a Christian Siriano black ruffle dress and the two paired very well. You think "cape"? But it's a great winter-to-spring transitional piece, especially when you're wearing it with a dress that has ruffle sleeves. The herringbone wool is lovely, although I do think the choice of buttons cheapen the look but that's just me. The dark blue silk lining helps counteract that.

Lovely cape coat perfect for in between seasons. My only complaint is that I rented the M/L size (I'm normally a size 8/10) and it was HUGE! I could have fit another person in with me! I'd rent again, but this time in a size small.

links_reviews_title: Why are we renting clothes if not to wear things like CAPES????
links_reviews_text: I had so much fun with this cape! The quality is great, so fun to wear with jeans or wore with black leggings and red rain boots. Also wore it with a burgundy Parker dress I rented and the pair looked so great together! I thought ahead and wore handle bags or clutches with this so didn't really bother me that you can't wear a shoulder strap. Was warm enough for the cold snap we've been having in SoCal. I highly recommend renting this!!
Was so warm and such a fun transition from coats

links_reviews_title: The fabric is nice and not at all scratchy. Paired well with a knee length formal dress.
links_reviews_text: The shoulders are much more structured than I expected so it got all bunched up around my neck if I tried to raise my arms or wear it with a shoulder bag. I enjoyed the look but found it too awkward for everyday use.

I wore this all day indoors at work on a rainy Friday and it was perfect. It would be fine outdoors, too as long as it's 50's. I think any lower temps would be a little chilly considering it's a cape and not a jacket. It is itchy as said in other reviews but not if you have on a long sleeved shirt. I paired it with a turtleneck and it was fine. I'm 28 weeks pregnant and would highly recommend for maternity wear! So flowy and comfortable. I don't foresee this as an everyday jacket, but great to add a little flair to an outfit. It could go casual or very dressy.
Wore it often and got tons of compliments!!

links_reviews_title: So cute and feel like it will be timeless!
links_reviews_text: Loved it so much I bought it!

I could not love this cape more. It's weighted - perfect for cold weather. It's versatile - will totally go with SO many outfits. I feel classy and grown but not stuffy...love. Will absolutely rent again.

This item was a stretch for me style wise; wasn't sure I was going to like it which is why RTR is great. Although the product descriptions should be so much clearer; I thought this item was gray and black, it looked gray and navy. Either way it wasn't for me.

links_reviews_title: Great structure, a little awkward to wear
links_reviews_text: Beautiful cape. Like many others said, size down as it's quite billowy. My main problem is because of the structure wearing a purse, bag, backpack was virtually impossible. Would save it for a night out/handbag vs. on the go.

links_reviews_title: Great if you wear tote bags
links_reviews_text: Not putting a backpack or a should strap was limiting. Looked great on and I got a lot of compliments, but I don't think it's for me.

links_reviews_title: A fun piece to try out!
links_reviews_text: Fit was true to size, wool was a little itchy around the neck. Only enhancement I can think of would be to add pockets.
Loved feeling like Nancy Drew while wearing this cape. So outside of my normal wardrobe. Plenty of room for lots of layers. The only downside is the arm holes give a limited range of motion.

links_reviews_title: Transitions nicely from office to out and about
links_reviews_text: Super cute -- easy, comfy outwear that looks super chic and put together with minimal effort. Great quality and very warm.
Super cute! True to size

links_reviews_title: I wasn't able to wear this because it was pretty large!
links_reviews_text: After trying on the cape, I realized that even with a smaller fitting cape, I'd probably still dislike the look of it. I didn't wear it after all.

links_reviews_title: Not my usual style but received complements both times i wore it
links_reviews_text: Roomy, but it's a cape.

I liked this classic, fun cape--although, I ended up wearing it less than I thought I would. It's tricky, even in Texas, to find a day when it was cool enough for heavy wool but warm enough not to have sleeves. The times I wore it I really liked it, though. It's the perfect thing to rent, in my opinion--the style is great to try but I probably don't need to own.

links_reviews_title: This look was just not for me. The quality was very nice and the cape was quite warm.
links_reviews_text: Nothing more to say.

links_reviews_title: It's classy and a major statement coat. Perfect for winter in Los Angeles.
links_reviews_text: It's gorgeous. No cons. A must if you want to feel great. Wore a short fitted dress underneath.

I rented this for a recent trip to NYC. The overall fit was good although the arm holes could have been a little smaller. I really had to keep my arms down otherwise the large arm slits made it feel like I wasn't wearing a coat.

links_reviews_title: Nice cape, sad it didn't work out
links_reviews_text: Perfect for mild winter weather we've been having in DC, however the M-L was way too big for me and didn't look flattering with my outfit. I'm between a size 6 and 8 in blazers so I went with the sizing populated. Will rent again in the future and try the small. The wool is nice and heavy and the large gold buttons are cute. I had on long sleeves so didn't notice the itchiness when I tried it on.
Wore this to work, got compliments all day long!! A little scratchy, but to be expected.
This jacket was just what I expected super cute and fit great!
Felt really classy wearing it.
this was very heavy// also made me feel very big.. didn't like it
Love, love, love everything about this cape. It's warm, versatile and hits at the right length. Will rent again soon.

Got compliments every time I wore this cape! I don't want to return and am considering buying it. This is great for a Southern winter but but since it is a cape and your arms are out, it might not be best for super cold weather.

links_reviews_title: I loved the style and fit, the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it had a faint smell.
links_reviews_text: Loved the piece, but a faint smell of stale cigarette bugged me all day. Even considered buying but decided against it.

Cute jacket - the one thing I didn't love was that you couldn't easily wear e a purse on your shoulder becasue of the arm holes. It makes sense because it is a cape, but I didn't think about that when I rented it.
Rented the M-L since the small was out of stock. I like oversized tops with skinny pants/jeans so it didn't bother me. Wore to work on a cold day and it kept me stylish and warm. Would rent again!
Fits exactly like it does on the model. Really flattering, especialy if you wear it with leggings.

I love the look of this cape, though it is very structured and bell shaped. I wear a small or xs usually and the petite/small was large. When sitting with the jacket buttoned, the collar is close to the chin and tight. Though the fit is a little off, it is a gorgeous fall jacket.
I love it! Thinking about purchasing it myself. You can dress it up or down.
Wool is a little scratchy but i generally enjoyed this piece.
This does run super large. If I were to rent for fashion purposes (as opposed to a costume) I would have dozed down to a large or medium for fit. Thick, well made and so cozy!!
The wool/acrylic yarn of this sweater make it so soft and cozy. Colors are vibrant and the hot pink piping on side seams are a nice touch. Easy to pair with dark navy or denim.
fits fine
Loved wearing this multiple times with different pant styles
Cute and warm, almost like a light jacket. Fun print.
Thick, warm sweater. Great knit in navy, acrid green and hot pink. Loved the colors!

LOVE this sweater - the fabric is heavy but very soft and fit me perfectly (I've got pretty broad shoulders and wide hips) and I got tons of compliments. An easy way to make an everyday outfit more fun!

links_reviews_title: This sweater was even cuter than the picture.
links_reviews_text: The sweater fit well, like a cardigan but was also very warm and was a bit chunky in a cozy way. The print was great and it was almost like a large waffle knit. I got tons of compliments and wore it a lot.

links_reviews_title: Didn't love. But funky vibes, could be cool with the right outfit.
links_reviews_text: Could be a cool look, but I tried to wear it for work and it just looked clunky. It didn't really hang right. Not worth the price if I didn't rent it through unlimited. Too clunky.

Sleeves are a tad long on my 5'4 frame. Also worn just like the sample photo fully buttoned even with my larger chest there was no pulling. Styled this with dark jeans and white sneakers with a fun earring for the office. Would definitely rent again!
I liked this sweater. It's high quality and felt nice. It wasn't particularly stylish or exciting but a good everyday sweater.
This cardigan is a beautiful textured knit with several colors that really work well together. It's very unusual but in a great way, and I got many complements. It's quite warm.
Fit well. Even for a smaller person.

links_reviews_title: I loved this sweater and I don't want to give it back.
links_reviews_text: I'll end up buying this for sure. I wore it every week and a few times on the weekend. Cute with skinny slightly distressed jeans and my sweet pink vans high tops. Also worn with clogs and also worn with boots. The question is what didn't I wear it with? I loved the color and I loved the fit. I have a long torso and it hit in a good spot!
Great sweater. Very warm and thick. Long sleeves. I got a lot of compliments on the design. Easy to layer. Would rent again and would buy if not so spendy!
This was cute for a day at work but I was surprised to find out that it was navy and not black. Material is also heavier than expected.
This sweater was nice and warm and the pattern on it was interesting but the fit was off and not flattering on me so I didn't end up wearing it except some around the house
Great for a warm winter sweater, can't button though as its too boxy.
Great weekend sweater

I didn't wear all the buttons buttoned because it made me look boxy. But I wore it open with a dress for work around a professional office. I got compliments. The only thing that bothered me was that it was heavier than I expected it to be. But overall it was cute and comfortable.

True to size, I am on the taller side so it was short if I bent over, and sleeves were "bracelet" length rather than full on me. Doesn't impact the overall vibe of the dress. Very cute pattern. Wore with tights and boots in winter.
This was a great dress for the office- really cute, colors outside of my normal palate, and not too short. The material felt nice and didn't wrinkle like I thought it would.
I went two sizes up from my normal size, given pregnancy and breast growth. It fit well, without ballooning and making me look unnecessarily large. Great work dress.
Love the print of this dress, perfect for work! Very lightweight material so I could wear it in the summer. Would definitely rent again!

Got tons of compliments on the dress! The print is really cool but still work appropriate. The fit was meh for me, but I suspect it's just how Tory Burch is cut. I'm a 4/6 in A line and 6/8 in shift dresses and this just barely fit okay across my hips in an 8. So if you're a pear, size up. The sleeves were a little long and it was wider in the shoulders than I'd have liked, but overall it was really fun.
Great dress for work. Wore with tights and booties. Pattern got lots of compliments.

Beautiful print for a nice spring day! I wore this to work and got a couple of compliments. The silk is nice but inevitably it wrinkled by the end of the day. Fit is true to size, but it's quite shapeless.

First off, this is a great work dress. I got many compliments, and I was comfortable all day. My only complaint would be that when seated, the slip would show a little. However, that didn't diminish how I feel about this dress! So gorgeous.

Pros to this dress are the fit (forgiving but still flattering) and the beautiful pattern. Definitely felt chic in it. It was a little on the short side for work, but still wearable (I'm 5'11"). I didn't find it very comfortable, though. It's not breathable, the sleeves were a tad short, and the neckline hit at an uncomfortable place. I wore this in around 55 degree weather and on the one hand felt sweaty up top but also wished I'd worn tights. I certainly wouldn't want to wear it in much warmer weather.

This is a lovely, well made, comfortable dress. The cuff details and covered button closure are elegant and the material is gorgeous. I'm normally not a fan of prints but this was elegant and the colors were feminine without being too girly. I am curvy/pear shaped and the lower half of the dress just fit without being tight but I can see how it might be a bit narrow on some. I really loved this dress. Perfect for work with nude stockings and nude shoes.
I belted it because I ordered it a little too large. The belt defined my waist and made it a little shorter. Silk dress. Feels high end.

I love this dress and it's the first time I've worn a RTR more than once. I wore it three times and got a ton of compliments. It's classic but stylish. I love this dress and would totally consider buying it!
I got loads of compliments on this dress. Very comfortable. It does wrinkle when you sit down but is otherwise perfect.

The dress was great except for the fact that it had been dry cleaned one too many times and the silk had shrunk while the slip still retained its length and would peek through by a centimeter or two. Overall I loved the ivory silk with the pattern and ended up buying it :) it has a forgiving fit. You can pair it with a belt if you want something more figure hugging.

This dress is perfect for business or a party where you need to be conservative but do not want to be dowdy or wear a boxy men's suit. The material is high quality and the pattern is fun and bold without the dress wearing you. I wore this for a really difficult meeting and felt very confident wearing it. I also plan to wear it to church and a party. It fits TTS on me, I wear a 6 in everything but DVF wrap dresses and really fitted dresses and a 6 fit well in this. Rent this one!!

Lovely dress. Fabric print is fun but still elegant thanks to the quality of the fabric itself. Length of dress was perfect - not too short even with heels. Dress wrinkled some after sitting down at dinner, but the wrinkles seemed to fall out relatively quickly. Very comfortable dress while also being elegant.

The fit is very loose but the gorgeous silky fabric and rich print makes this dress look and feel luxe. Wore it with black tights and black booties for work but rent it back to wear with nude pumps for Christmas. Love!
This looked big so I sized down and it worked perfectly. Works well for everyday with tights and boots. Such a nice pattern.

The material is quite thin, and the dress doesn't have a natural shape -- as much as I loves the pattern, if wasn't the most flattering for my individual body type. Rather modest dress, would have been better for a more formal occasion than the one I was attending perhaps.
Worn for work but versatile. Silky fabric, true-to-size fit, beautiful pattern. I loved it!
Comfortable. Fit true to size in chest.
You can dress this shift miracle down with causal ankle boots for everyday. The outer material is silk making the fabric feel soft and expensive.

links_reviews_title: Cute, a bit large for a small frame.
links_reviews_text: I liked the fabric and pattern, lovely. Hung a little too loose even for work, and a bit too long for me at 5'2". Still, something new and fresh for work instead of standard black sheath, got a couple compliments on it.
I wore this on a chilly day in early November with tights, but it could also be worn in warmer weather. I'm 10 weeks postpartum and found this to be forgiving yet true to size as I was a 4 pre baby.

The 4 wasn't available, so I tried the 6. It worked pretty well through the shoulders and chest, but left me a bit more room in the midsection than I would have preferred. The style is definitely more of a straight shift, so there isn't a ton of shape anyway. The length was great for work and didn't ride up when I sat down, thankfully. Paired with tall boots and no tights, but would be great with tights in cooler weather. Very comfortable to wear. And the print is gorgeous - got several compliments.
I wore this for a business meeting and got tons of compliments. It is a "safe" length, knee on me, and a loose fit. I'd definitely rent it again for a special occasion. #wedding
Fell in love right out of the bag! Wore to work at a high school and got loads of compliments from students and teachers. The print is amazing... would make a beautiful dress for a night out, too!

links_reviews_title: Rented as part of unlimited plan and wore to work.
links_reviews_text: Pretty fabric and pattern. Simple dress, but pretty detailing on the sleeves. A great work dress.

links_reviews_title: Cute, better for events not work
links_reviews_text: This dress is super cute, and works fine with a blazer but there's a keyhole in the back that is low enough that it shows the top of a bra, so wouldn't be good for work otherwise. It's also a bit see through, so better for brunch or a date!

links_reviews_title: This dress is not for women that have curves ...
links_reviews_text: This might be cuter if it had a bit of an A line cut to it but it gets stuck at the hips. If I would have sized up it would have been too big all together.
It was comfortable and fit well, and I felt like I looked nice in it. Numerous people complimented it.

links_reviews_title: Very beautiful dress worked well for a wedding shower. Could not get the photo to upload
links_reviews_text: Pros - Fit well for a petite person, could easily dress up or dress down Cons - wrinkles very easily.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful design, however would choose a smaller size as the dress runs large.
links_reviews_text: Appropriate for work
This was perfect for work. Hid all my bad features and looked expensive.

links_reviews_title: More flattering in person; beautiful material
links_reviews_text: I really liked the simplicity of this dress. It was easy to wear and runs a bit large but didn't look like I was drowning in it. The colours and feel of the material are lovely. Would rent again.
Length was fine for work on me, I'm 5'8"
Runs a bit large in waist and then small at hips and bust. I used a belt to give the dress more shape. Many compliments received.
I wear a 4 or 6 depending on designer and I would definitely get a 2 if I got this one again. It was quite baggy all over. Wrinkles easily too but fun and different for work
Gorgeous, stunning. Loved everything about this dress.

The print on this dress is absolutely stunning, I love the colors! This fit a little tight in the shoulders for me, and it was a little too cold to wear without tights (it looks MUCH better with bare legs). Perfect dress for the few warm and sunny days in spring.
The design overall is good, casual but the material for the tie and the sleeves are shiny and heavy..
Fit was ok but the sequin collar was thick and looked cheap to me. Didn't end up wearing.
Loved the details in the sleeves. The cut and fabric was very flattering.

links_reviews_title: A fun update to a traditional black blouse
links_reviews_text: Very nice fit and structure. The white scarf/tie and cuffs are sequins. Sometimes the V was a tiny bit too low for my liking but overall I thought this was a great shirt that is appropriate for work or out.
This top made getting ready for work very simple! Loved the detail.
This fit a little small in the chest and arms, but seemed to be from to much dry cleaning. The material was thin, but not see-through. I liked how it looked and could be dressed up or down.

links_reviews_title: Classic top with a little sparkle
links_reviews_text: I really liked this shirt, especially the sparkly white tie. I wore it to work with black pants and black wedges, and felt super classy and sleek.

links_reviews_title: fun top to transition from day to night
links_reviews_text: Beautiful top that goes from daytime to nighttime seamlessly :)

links_reviews_title: Worn for work. Bump friendly but too exposing in bust.
links_reviews_text: V too low for work.

links_reviews_title: Easy with a touch of sparkle
links_reviews_text: The shirt runs on the roomier side, the size 6 fit very comfortably over my hips. It was a little low cut, but the tie covered any exposure up. I got complements galore. It's well made and seems to have stood the test of time since this has been in my hearts for a while and is still in good condition -- a few not really noticeable sequins missing here and there.
I love this top. The material was perfect for spring and the color was just elegant. I got compliments and would consider buying it in the future.

Cute shirt with a little flare. Wore it tucked in to black slim fit pants with flats, and it dressed up an otherwise boring all black outfit. It is a rayon type material, and not silk, so if you are prone to sweating, it will get a little gross in the armpits by the end of the day.
This was a nice top for work. The white areas are covered in sequins. It's not obvious from the picture. It is a nice but not that exciting.

links_reviews_title: Love this top. It's easy to wear and I received a lot of compliments on it!
links_reviews_text: Very polished look that was super-simple to take on a work trip.

Beautiful top that fit great, even the arm length for me (and I'm short). It had some give overall and the cuffs were lined so the sequins didn't scratch. The sequins were subtle enough to wear this top in a corporate enviro yet special enough to transition to a nice dinner out. Will rent again!
Wore at 22 weeks pregnant and you couldnt even tell I had a bump. Shirt was great. 4 stars because it had a button missing on the sleeve and was showing wear in the back.

links_reviews_title: Wore for our date night and also to work. Tons of compliments!
links_reviews_text: Beautiful top. Loose fitting. The tie is sequins, but not overly so.

links_reviews_title: Loved it! wore to a 40th bday party
links_reviews_text: cute, drapey - you can tie it multiple ways - received lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: I wore this fun Rachel Zoe Top to a wedding reception with cigarette pants and it looked great!
links_reviews_text: Fit well, the tie is a little hard to tie in a bow, so I left it tied in a knot and hanging. Many compliments on this look! Thanks RTR.

The sequins jazz it up a bit. I am usually a 6 but ordered a 4 since 6 was not available, and it worked out just fine. I like the fit of the blouse but the tie sat a bit funny on the neckline/chest. Still, I was pretty pleased with it.
Arms were too small

links_reviews_title: Didn't like the shoulders because I have big shoulders. Overall great quality shirt
links_reviews_text: Like the tie
Didn't wear

This top fit true to size. The tie was a bit tricky to figure out. The tie and cuffs are muted sequins. I wore it with a black pencil skirt and black pumps to a concert and I felt very sophisticated and polished. It would also look super-cute with jeans and black oxfords.
Such a great blouse, the only con was the shoulder part ran a bit small but it still fit. The sequin is gorgeous!!!

I wish I could buy this top, it is so flattering and works for everything - work, date night, party - it hangs long so you can wear with leggings, black work pants, jeans or a tailored skirt. It runs big though and you don't want it to be oversized otherwise the V in the front will show your bra. I love this top and recommend it to anyone who wants a versatile top for the season.

Didn't realize white was sequence, too dressy for work. Great for an event. It was snug, i am busty i think 14 would have fit. Overall cute blouse for more exciting night out, perhaps w dressier leggings and boots!
This top was beautiful. I loved the sequin detail, so fun!
Loved this! Tons of compliments and. Rey flattering cut.

Loved this dress. The material is very high quality but light and breathable. The color is great, and the whole fit and look is very tailored and put together. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that the arm holes were a little snug, but to be fair, I have muscular arms. Still loved it though and would rent again.
Felt good in this one. Will rent again

This dress almost a 5. The only thing I didn't like is that bunches up a little bit so I had to keep pulling it down. Other than that it was comfortable, and a nice material and navy color. Such a cute style for work.
Wore to work, received compliments

Very good dress for a summer workday - professional length, cool, wrinkle-resistant fabric, and can never go wrong with navy. The popover-style top and grommets make it more interesting than otherwise what would be a sheath dress.
Beautiful navy. Super flattering. Perfect dress for work
Really cute, I got a lot of compliments!

links_reviews_title: Great dress. Looks great on and feels great
links_reviews_text: FIt’s great. Good for a curvaceous body. Conservative yet very flattering
Fit great, super comfortable. I have a mom belly and it didn't look too bad in the dress. Got a lot of compliments during the day.

I got so many compliments on this dress and blazer rental. I'm usually between a 6 and an 8. I got the 6 and it fit perfectly. Highly recommend this. I'll rent again. Very cute. The bow ships a little wrinkled just press it with a towel and iron

links_reviews_title: Perfect for work or date night. Stretchy but still looks professional and expensive!
links_reviews_text: I really liked this dress! I'm 5' 2"ish and the length was perfect for me! I wore it with and without a shirt underneath it and it looked great with both. It definitely had stretch, but didn't look sloppy. Would be perfect for the office or wedding. You could pair it with a blazer or dress it up with heels and statement necklace. I would wear this again!

This was a great dress for work. I received many compliments throughout the day. It is loose in the top, so it helps hide a bit of the stomach area. The rest of the dress is fitted and form fitting. It was not too tight, so it was very comfortable throughout the day.

links_reviews_title: Loved everything about it....I ended up buying it!
links_reviews_text: The fit was perfect - loved the cropped overlay. It is very Jacki O.

This fits like a glove. The material is a bit stretchy, but it doesn't LOOK stretchy. I have a tummy, which this dress nicely minimizes. I loved this so much that I bought it! (The thought of having to send it back made me sad beyond words.)
Fit great and was very comfortable. The tie in the front was a little wonky but besides that it was a hit!
This was perfect for both work and a wedding. I loved it and was very comfortable in it. The material was very comfortable. I am considering purchasing it.
The photo doesn't convey well - we are renovating so my space and lighting is not great! I received several compliments the day I wore this to work. I was tempted to keep it but sent it back!
Loved it
I went up to the 4 and that was the perfect fit. I'm usually between sizes 2 and 4. Unique and professional dress. Received compliments. Would rent it again.

links_reviews_title: Super cute and comfortable work dress!
links_reviews_text: Rented this dress for work and it is one of my favorite rentals yet. The cut is so flattering and comfortable too! A bit big in the chest for small chested ladies, but I think I still pulled it off. Wish I had a pair of nude shoes to go with. Overall, really loved this dress.

I could live in this dress. In fact, I wore it two days in a row for two presentations (in two different cities). Material is great for business travel - barely any wrinkles! Tons of compliments and I felt really put together.

The photo does NOT do this dress justice. It looked like it was tailored to my body. The material didn't have much give, but was super easy to dance in. I felt really beautiful at the salsa event and got a number of compliments. It was simple and understated which made the perfect fit really shine. I also loved that I could wear a normal bra with it. Length was also very modest.
This dress was just like a glove. The material. The fit. I am trying to rent every dress from BM that's this style. So slimming. True to size.

I loved this dress, the material felt very comfortable. Although it was a bit snug for a curvy person, it did not feel uncomfortable at all. The length was great for me for the event I attended. Would rent again.

Fit is true to size and definitely no stretch. Great option for work. I wore it for a client meeting. My one complaint is it's really difficult to zip up because it gets stuck on the fabric about halfway.

My picture doesn't do it justice. I would never ha be thought this would be the perfect dress for me. I'm glad I took a chance on it. Fits like a dream. Looks and feels so professional and ladylike. Wish I could purchase! Will rent again.

Absolutely loved this dress and wore it 3 times. Was a bit tighter than expected (not that it ran small, exactly, I wouldn't size up if I got it again) it was just tighter throughout the skirt than I had expected. Could make it a bit too sexy for some environments. Really comfy and great quality fabric.

links_reviews_title: I would buy this in a heartbeat
links_reviews_text: I wore this to my sons baptism. I had originally rented another dress and got a text the week before telling me that dress was no longer available. This was my alternate dress. I had a baby in December and wore this in May. I sized up considerably because I was nervous with my experience wearing Badgley Mischka I've found them to run small. This was true to size of not even a little large but again my post baby body has me wearing a 14/16 depending on what I wear. Regardless I got nothing but compliments all day, it hid what I needed it to and was the absolute perfect dress for my sons day. I would buy if I could I love it THAT much!!!! Thank you Rent the Runway for making me look fabulous once again!

This adorable dress is perfect for a work function. It runs true to size but it doesn't have much stretch and is very fitted in the hips so you should definitely consider sizing up if you have curvy hips like me. This style is fitted throughout. It works for any cup size and you can wear a standard bra At 5'3 the length hit knee length on me. Looks amazing with a pointy toe pump!
Beautiful navy dress with a very nice fit. Well made and lined. Very pretty and flattering on full figures
This dress is adorable! So cute for work or weekend or whatever. Very versatile.
perfect for work

This is the perfect work dress! Classy, but not over the top! Felt very well taken care of and covered tummy area. I will say the tie is rigged closed, but in an odd way. Wish it was just a normal tie. Despite that, love the dress! Wish I owed.
fit was true to size. it's a work dress with a bit of a flare; looks better in person. would rent again
I followed the app's direction and went a size up. That was a mistake! Will order again and go with a size down. It is cute.

Fit like a glove! Fit to the body but not tight. Great for curves. I'm between a 12 and 14 normally. I ordered the 14 and had a little wiggle room but not sure if the 12 would've been too tight or not. Very flattering in stomach area, didn't really need to wear anything to suck it in! ;) Considering buying this!
Flattering and comfortable

links_reviews_title: Classy and chic, but not forgiving in the tummy area
links_reviews_text: I rented this dress for a rehearsal dinner in Nantucket and it looked even more elegant in person. I usually wear a size 14 but I sized up and got a 16 in this dress. I really, really wanted to make this dress work, but it didn't flatter my bottom half even with 2 pairs of spanx and a size bigger.
Super cute, work for work conference with nude pumps and a blazer. Definitely needed 2 people for the zipper. It wasn't tight but it kept snagging on the lining.

I'm not a huge fan of ponchos but my husband loved it. Took it on vacation and it was very comfortable and versatile. It kept me warm when it was cold out but when it warmed up, there was enough ventilation to also keep me cool. Easy to move my arms in and out while I was walking which sounds strange but worked out very well, to access pockets and sometimes, a purse I wore under the poncho.
Love the details and fabric of this piece. Definitely recommend for a daily wear piece.
I love ponchos but this was just too oversized and shapeless
I wore this piece several times --to a dinner/game night, to church, and to work. It's easy to wear with a long sleeve shirt and skinny jeans or leggings. I felt comfortable, yet put together.

Wear this with anything. It's amazing. But beware it is warm. Pair it with leggings or skinny jeans and wear it to the office. I love that it's sewn on the arms so it's got arm holes instead of being "fully exposed" or wide open.
Was really thick so it was great for colder weather. I will say I'm a size 16 and the poncho was a little loose on me still, so this poncho might be huge for smaller sizes.

links_reviews_title: Fun winter poncho- comfortable & fun to wear!
links_reviews_text: #everyday #poncho #comfortable
More like a boiled wool so stiffer than i expected but still enjoyable to wear.
Loved wearing this poncho! It was effortless and classy.
Runs large even for a poncho. The material is uncomfortable and rough as well. I did really love the gray/black color combo.

Yes, it is big. But it worked. Wore with black pants and shirt, black heels to work. Added a scarf for some color, but could have done a long, chunky necklace instead. Fabric is nice, just an easy thing to throw on and go. Recommend and would wear again.
This is a great cape. Beautiful. Nice material. Very soft. I would have kept it longer but our fall was so short!
Perfect for pregnancy! So cute. Wish it had pockets. Love the stripe details.
I'm 5'3" and this was just too massive to wear. The fabric was just OK. I immediately returned it and did not wear it out.
Loved it! Fit over everything and made me look stylish
Wildly oversized and shapeless. I know it's a poncho so it's mean to be extra drapey, but this made me look like a tent.
I live this poncho and wore it a million times. It's comfy, not scratchy and one of the only One Size items that doesn't literally swallow you whole. Super great for traveling. Get it!

links_reviews_title: Great fit! keeps you super warm.
links_reviews_text: As this is one size fits all, it is a great fit. Adorable and nice fit.
Too big and bulky

I love flattering ponchos in my third trimester, and this is a great one. You won't look like you're wearing a tent! The fabric feels kinda weird, though - very scratchy but light. I'd recommend wearing a thin long sleeved shirt underneath to avoid itchiness.
It was a little worn and I didn't like the fit. Didn't wear.
Thinking of buying this as it's very cozy and flattering. Lovely, warm material that lies beautifully! Paired with skinny jeans and boots for a stylish and casual look!
love this and tempted to keep it
Great designer poncho and... it runs large and heavy. Received many compliments.
A little boxy but so warm

links_reviews_title: Great for a fall outdoor day
links_reviews_text: Wore this on a weekend trip where we spent the day outside. Everyone loved it!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful on the model, overwhelming for my small frame.
links_reviews_text: I didn't realize this is a wool piece, so the material was very heavy and bulky for my petite frame. If you carry extra weight, I wouldn't recommend wearing this, because it will accentuate that.

Rented this for football season. It's perfect for a cold outdoor event. It runs a little bit large. I'm 5'2" and while I could wear it, the length is a little too long. But with tall black boots it worked.
I was really excited because I love a good poncho! This unfortunately I hated so much I sent back immediately. I did not like the material and it honestly looked like I was wearing a table cloth.
It was very heavy, did not lay very well. I only wore it once.

links_reviews_title: This is perfect for cool Nashville rainy days! Paired with boots, it is super comfy and warm.
links_reviews_text: This would engulf a smaller person... not a problem for me! A little stiff but that helps it retain a cool shape. Not itchy at all.

links_reviews_title: This is a beautiful piece of fabric. I got so many compliments.
links_reviews_text: I never thought I'd like a poncho. Who knew? Obviously, it's incredibly flattering as well.

links_reviews_title: Great lightweight alternative to a jacket!
links_reviews_text: I love boiled wool fabric this poncho is made of. It was very warm, but not itchy. Easy to throw on and go. Perfect for a quick trip to San Francisco =)!

links_reviews_title: I wore this to work on a cold day
links_reviews_text: Very stylish way to dress up plain black pants and a black turtleneck. It was very warm though, being wool, and having a turtleneck underneath. Great for days where the temperature is below freezing!

I loved this poncho! I would throw it on every time for a quick trip to the store or just laying around the house. Fabric a little heavy but good to keep you warm. I am a BBW size 26 and tall, this covered me nicely past my buttocks and stomach area.
Enjoyed wearing it
Very thick - the wool is a little dry and doesn't hang as gently as in the model. But I love this anyway. Perfect.
This is great to wear if you want to ditch your winter coat for a little. It is a very thick material and warm.
Perfect for a cold day! Very comfortable and received a lot of compliments.
Comfy fit, great for running errands around the city and still looking chic, love being able to have my arms free. Would buy if wasn't so expensive.
This was fun to pair with a top I already owned, but it's hard to tuck anything into it without showing a bulge.

links_reviews_title: Size down, kinda loose around the waist!
links_reviews_text: Thick material so it'll cover well, but I'd recommend sizing down! I had an 8 recommended and it was too big
This skirt fit perfectly, was easy to wear and I got a lot of compliments. Loved it and thought about keeping it.

Loved this skirt! Wore it on a night out and appreciated not having to be self conscious about pale legs or to have to wear tights! It's super sexy and the colors are great. Fabric is soft and stretchy.

I got a larger size because I usually don't like tight waist bands on skirts so I'm not sure how the sizing actually ran but I LOVED this skirt. I wore it for a daytime party with a leather jacket and for a brunch with a crop top. I think you could wear this In so many ways through most of the seasons. It is a heavier knit so even though there is a high slit for some breathability I would not recommend for summer time. Great for spring!

links_reviews_title: Cutest skirt! Fit great and looked even better!
links_reviews_text: Fit was perfect. Would've bought if it wasn't less expensive!

Nice colors and heavy fabric. Loved it in the pictures and when I received it. Didn't feel quite as fantastic when I wore it out though. It kinda felt heavy and too big. Maybe it stretches some as the night wears on.

links_reviews_title: Bold and comfortable. An easy to pair statement piece even for skirt Non-believers
links_reviews_text: I sized way up because I hate elastic waistband clothing. No need. I recommend getting your true size. I NEVER wear skirts but wore this one twice. One with a fitted mock choker bodysuit and once with an oversized black sweater. Lots of compliments. The slit takes it from frumpy to fabulous. Love the color blocking!
Absolutely loved this skirt wore several times. Skirt is thick and warm very flattering. I will rent again (maybe even buy it when it goes on sale).

links_reviews_title: Compliments from men and women alike!
links_reviews_text: This was my first rental and it fit pretty well and looked great for a midtown job. Eveyone at work gave me compliments and plus it sucked things in at all the right places!
