I mistakenly got size 6 (usually a 4) but the 6 fit fine. I would recommend sizing up if you're not too short !

The skirt was too big on me, but not so big that it was unwearable. I'm normally a 2/4 and should have ordered a smaller size. The skirt is a standout and perfect for fall. I will definitely rent it again in a smaller size!
Fits a tad big because I'm smaller in the waist than hips but it's a show stopper for any occasion.

links_reviews_title: So many compliments, love the slit.
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable, fabric is a little heavier, but not bad. Loved it!
Tight fit but rtr sized me up so it fit perfectly!
Love! The color blocking is awesome. Stretchy, elastic waistband so go with your normal size. Easy to walk in, as the slit is high. Must rent.

I love this trendy style! Running true to size with a lot of stretch, I recommend wearing your true size and going up for your back up. This style is fitted up top and loose at the hips. At height 5'2, the length hit right at my ankles. Pair with heels or flats to complete your outfit!

Wore it to work and got compliments from coworkers to strangers in the elevator. I paired it with a flowy black sleeveless that I could tuck in. Would wear/rent again. The sizing is European. I normally wear a 4 and ordered an 8. The skirt is not forgiving, but that adds to it being dramatic. Need decent height to pull it off. I'm almost 5'8", so it worked, but I think it would be tough if you were 5'5".
loved this skirt. it is a nice, thick material so it felt very high quality. the slit on the side made it a little sexy, and the colors were bold and fun. would definitely rent again.

I absolutely loved this skirt! I wore it to a huge meeting and got so many compliments! I felt so glam in it! The only thing I would recommend is sizing down. Otherwise it was perfect! Would definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Very easy to wear. Preferred with a black body suit.
links_reviews_text: The straight cut of the skirt is very flattering. I felt to cut was still ok for my office. Stretchy fabric. Reviews said to go one size up and was happy I did.
Worn over a sleeveless dress to a wedding. Perfect length and did not take away from the dress. Would definitely consider buying it.

links_reviews_title: Heavy and good quality. Stretchy so can go smaller
links_reviews_text: I liked this skirt but it wasn't very flattering in the tummy area for me. The 8 for me but could have also sized down to a 6. It's quite different and pretty. I had fun wearing it.
Love the slit on this skirt, I sized up when a true size would have been best
Wore it to work and loved it!
Fit was great but I had to get it two sizes too big bc it's never available in my true size. Rolled the top. But otherwise I wore it with white booties and I received compliments all day

Crisp, professional look that's comfortable and easy to move in. Bonus points: it's in the brand colors for my business. It's thick enough for cooler days, but the slit keeps it from being too hot. Beware, it's clingier than it looks; check for pantylines.

links_reviews_title: This is so fun and sexy!
links_reviews_text: Absolutely loved this. Sized up to an 8 for a comfortable fit!
Loved how it fit and moved. Slit is great
Super nice material, can be dressed up or down, with flat boots or heels...loved it!
Loved this skirt. So comfy and easy to wear all day. The black makes it slimming. Runs pretty true to size, but if you're in between sizes I would size down.
Skirt did nothing for me. Didn't wear it. Felt like it looked a little off on a long frame
Tight fitting so size up if between sizes. Unfortunately the smaller size was not flattering on me so sent it back.
Unfortunately, this skirt was too tight for work and too short to wear with heels. It was well made and gorgeous though. Sad it didn't work out.
Gorgeous skirt, absolutely loved it, the slit is a little bit high, I had to place my napkin over the skirt at dinner to keep myself from showing too much skin.

Fun statement skirt thats thick material makes it good to wear in the winter! Wore with tights and booties to work with a sweater. May take off tights for dinner later to get a little slit action going! #yolo
I am 5'1" and the extra small came right to my ankles. The material is beautiful I just did not think it was flattering on me so I did not wear it
Everything was perfect
fits well.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous, stretchy and comfortable. Totally photogenic.
links_reviews_text: I wore this to Art Basel in Miami with a black shell and then again to my husband's work Christmas party with a black sweater. I'm 5'8", size 4, and the UK 8 fit perfectly and hit right above my ankle bone. It's stretchy, so if you have a little waist and bigger hip, I'd probably try the size that fits your waist. Super photogenic.
Runs very long - I'm 5'8 and had to roll the band so it would hit at my true waist. Other than that, loved it and got many compliments.

links_reviews_title: This bag is not getting returned.
links_reviews_text: Perfect size. Light weight which is good because of all the stuff I pack it with. Classy yet still fashion forward. Soon as the price comes down I am snagging it.
Loved how spacious this bag was. It was easy to carry and I loved the material. Easy match to any outfit. Good for everyday work attire.
I love All Saints bags. Great quality roomy tote.
I loved the size and structure of this bag for work! It fit a file folder and my dell laptop with no problem. Has a side pocket and a wallet insert.

Nice everyday bag that's big enough for work, commuting etc. Easily held umbrella, big water bottle, etc. Was in good condition upon arrival. Structured enough to stand up on its own with slumping too much. Nice enough but would not pay retail price for this bag- it does not feel or look overly luxe. Could use another inside compartment but I like that it did come with a matching zipper bag.
This bag was great for work, it's big enough to fit my gym kit too when needed and looks so sleek
Leather is beautiful, loved it so much! Would rent again a thousand times. Very large and roomy for my laptop (13 inch). Small compartment and bag inside, otherwise just roomy.
I'm absolutely obsessed with this bag. One of my fav all time rentals
LOVE this bag. Great size, love the inner pouch that zips closed to keep valuables. Got a ton of compliments on this bag.
love this bag. great quality, and "magically" big without looking it. fit gym clothes, laptop, wallet and misc baby items comfortably.
This bag was awesome. It’s very roomy, so I was able to carry around a lot. It also has a detachable clutch inside, which worked out perfectly!
Wore this to a wedding and it really added a great pop of color to my outfit! It's beautifully made with an interesting shape. Holds together well. Fit my phone, a couple cards, lipstick, and lotion!

This purse is super cute, even better in person. I love it so much Ive held on to it for awhile. Im so impressed with the size, its perfect for travel and everyday. Great quality, looks high end, the color is stunning. I get so many compliments. I love that the strap can easily be made shorter or longer to switch up the formality of it!

This bag is incredibly chic and elevates every ensemble. The color is surprisingly versatile, and will transition through all seasons (depending on what you pair it with). It fits my phone, AirPod case, keys, lipstick and small card case perfectly. Loved it so much, I bought it!

Love love loved it because it was very light weight. And When you put your phone in, it's the perfect weight enough to stay on your shoulder. It is also easy to open and close. Not to mention the elegant/unique design!
Wore for weekend and work. A solid fall/winter dress that's very forgiving and easy to wear.

Originally rented this for work, but it was a little short so I wore it to happy hour instead. I got so many compliments, and loved it with my riding boots. The cute is definitely unique, but not for work!
Just a tad tight in arms and bast and slightly short enough that I would have preferred a size up for work.
So fun fit well!!

links_reviews_title: Loved this dress. Felt like a cute solider!
links_reviews_text: Thick material so nice and warm

I LOVE this dress. I feel so cute in it! I initially rented it in my usual size 6 and was disappointed. I gave it another chance with the size 4 and I am SO happy. My husband says he loves it and I agree! I would be cautious about the little slits in the front... they can show the control top portion of your tights if you're not careful. I wore this to work and also out to dinner. I want to own this dress!!

Fabric is thick and forgiving. I'm 5'1 so it was a perfect length for me. It runs big. It fitted well on my upper body but loose on my waist and hips. It's very profesional but a little sexy at the same time. It looks better in person than in the picture

I loved the simple yet militaristic design of this dress, but alas it was way too short for my 6'1" stature. I have a flat stomach, but this really accentuated the curvature of that area and made it feel like I'd need to wear Spanx with it. The butt area was also too high up, so there was a gap between my body and the fabric. Overall great material & design, but would probably work better for someone shorter!
I loved the way this dress fit and the fabric is heavy enough to hide the lumps. I'll 5'2" and 115 so the length was perfect for a work dress. I'm definitely thinking about buying this dress
I rented this for a work trip in Barcelona. Then found out it was smart casual dress code. I loved the dress so i paired it with booties and minimal jewelery.

The fabric is a heavy weight cotton feel so it's super comfy. The pleat in the front gives it a little 'sexy' but not over the top. The sleeves were snug but not uncomfortable. I wore it to work in an professional office setting and received tons of compliments on it. I Would definitely 'rent' again. It's a nice dress for day to happy hour...

links_reviews_title: Cute dress, but a little on the short side
links_reviews_text: This dress looked great on and I loved the color. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is kind of short especially when sitting down and the slits open up. Giving four stars because even though the dress fit everywhere else, it was a little snug in the shouldee area.
I love love love this dress! Its a little short but with tights it works. Cute, trendy and fun dress!

links_reviews_title: Fun fall look but watch the hem!
links_reviews_text: This was a fun dress to wear. A true olive, so keep in mind if that doesn't work for your skin tone. The gold buttons are a nice touch and pair well with a necklace (which I recommend because of the neckline). My only caution: This dress is short, and it gets shorter when you're sitting. I highly recommend wearing tights with this. Also the neckline can be a bit risky, depending on your workplace. There IS a hint of cleavage.
Not flattering at all on my body. Thick fabric and too long.
Really cute dress. Great material and design. I'm 5'4" and it's too short for work. Would be good for a party.
The fit is TTS and so comfortable! One of my favorite work dresses!

Pros: the material is nice and kept me warm on this cold rainy day with tights and boots. Cons: Although, the dress fit me in the waist, the top was a bit big for my frame. It was a little too low cut for my comfort at work and the sleeves were a tad too long.
I got so many compliments wearing this dress. It's so comfortable and perfect for work with tights but could also be dressed down. Will likely rent again.
This dress was very small and short. Material really heavy, I was thinking about ordering a larger size, size 10! I normally wear a 6 or 8. Might rent again in the winter.

Love the style concept but not the execution. Thin material makes it fall strangely around the midsection, making it almost baggy. Not figure flattering for me. Very short, which is usually fine for me as a petite, but the slits up the front aren't flattering either.

links_reviews_title: A bit short for office wear
links_reviews_text: Dress fits me nicely, but shorter than I expected. I don't think I can wear it to the work place unless I wear some dark stockings and paired it with knee boots.
This was so tight in the hips and tummy that the panels were pulling open. Couldn't wear it.
Wore to work but was uncomfortable because of length and slits in front open very easily

Waited forever for this dress to become available in my size. Sadly was disappointed, as the fit was not flattering and dress was not at all cute on me. Very loose through the waist area and short for work, even though I'm only 5 feet.
Nice color

links_reviews_title: Super comfortable when I sized up just a little.
links_reviews_text: Might be a little short on someone who's taller.
Fits nice but short

links_reviews_title: Way too short to wear to work.
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly. But it was so short you can see the bottoms of my buns when I walked.
Slimming thicker fabric. Love the nautical button detail. Very flattering cute dress. Definitely on the short side but nothing a pair of tights couldn't fix if you wanted to wear it to the office.

I really wanted to love this dress, and had the perfect occasion to showcase its military vibes. I ordered a 2 rather than a 0 due to the warnings of it running small... not the case for me. This dress seemed universally an inch too wide/long on every seam. If I were able to get a smaller size in time for my theme event I might order again, but if not inspired to have military vibe I don't know that is was cute/flattering enough.
Great for short girls as it runs short. Super comfy for work!

This was very cute! If you're large chested this dress def flatters without showing too much cleavage. I ordered a size 2 and it fit great in the chest and hip areas but did have a bit of extra fabric around the stomach which was fine. Dress was not too short when you stood up but be careful when sitting especially since there are two slits. I wore with black opaque tights and over the knee healed black boots.

So very well made and modern without being trendy. I love the olive green color with a hint of military. The material is heavy so perfect for winter. I wore this with Rachel Zoe mid calf black ankle boots and a tailored Kate Spade black coat. It was very chic.
The slits are real so standing better than sitting if that helps.

links_reviews_title: Great fit for my bust, a little short
links_reviews_text: I enjoyed the color and fit. Very comfortable but had to wear leggings under it as it was short even on my short legs.

links_reviews_title: Okay dress for an okay workday
links_reviews_text: This dress was fine. I don't think it was a stunner or anything, but it was good for a normal day at the office. Sleeves are nice when the a/c is blasting. I paired with black tights to make it a little more work appropriate.

links_reviews_title: Comfy, stylish, great color, just enough stretch!
links_reviews_text: B/c it's a little short, I wore tights with either heels or boots. Received tons of compliments! It is somewhat form fitting but the sleeves balance it out.
This dress came with a rip on the v-neck. It was also really tight. I usually wear a size 6-8, but the 8 was snug.

links_reviews_title: Was sent the wrong size. Runs small. Not great for work - too short.
links_reviews_text: Wouldn't wear again. Odd color.
Thick and comfy but very oversized. Would go for XS next time. Colors are more pastel-y peach and blue in person vs. beige and gray

This sweater is just great! I wore the medium, my normal size. It fit perfectly as an oversized sweater-the sleeve length hit right at my wrists. The pink and blue threading in the sweater gave it a fun pop of color.

This sweater is about exactly what you'd expect. It's medium-soft, slouchy, and super comfy. I got lots of compliments. It looks tan from far away, but the yarn has thin threads of bright orange and light blue woven through that you can see up close which is a fun detail. It's square cut, but it's got long slits on each side so you get a subtle tapered silhouette. I probably could have gone with a XS but I liked how the S fit. I am 5'0" and the sweater went to a few inches above my knees.

Took to Chicago because I knew it would be chilly . Warm and soft , very comfortable. It is large and boxy but I love that !!!! Would have loved to wear with booties but I was going to be walking a lot ! Was happy with this rental .
Not itchy at all. Runs large but the fit is supposed to be worn large. Will definitely rent again for a low key weekend!

I got this sweater as some maternity day to day wear. Currently at 26 weeks - and just at the size wear I don't have a lot of options with my normal clothes. I've worn it at least three times in a week. Super comfortable, looks great. I love the length especially right now because I am living in maternity leggings so it is nice to have something a little longer to cover my butt. Also love that it doesn't look like maternity clothes. Highly recommend!

The sweater fit exactly how I was expecting - oversized while still trendy. The quality of the sweater was great and the details in the threading were a nice surprise which I couldn't tell from online
The colors worked well for a chilly spring day. Very soft and nice for a casual day with denim. Fit was tts with an oversized feel:
Nothing special, wore it over the weekend and didn't like it enough to wear again to work. Would not rent again.
Great sweater, warm, beautiful tonal thread colors, but snagged easily.
Very comfortable and heavy fabric. Great for a chilly day. The sleeves were an awkward length on me so I rolled them up. Otherwise a great fit.
Perfect oversized sweater for leggings or skinny jeans! Loved it so very much considered keeping it. Peekaboo slits on the sides are flattering. Received so many compliments. Will rent again!

links_reviews_title: Big, baggy sweater but it's a great material and really warm.
links_reviews_text: n/a

links_reviews_title: Such a good cozy sweater but the strings kept getting stuck in my coat!
links_reviews_text: Loved this sweater and wore it so much. It is definitely oversized but snugs the body well. Great with leggings or jeans. The only downside was the threads kept getting stuck in the zipper of my jacket. Was very annoying.
SO comfortable. Perfect with leather leggings or jeans. Lots of compliments. I could live in it forever.

This is the sweater that goes from work to dinner to running errands to throw over your workout clothes to Netflix marathon and back to work again...and everywhere in between...it's that sweater you are always looking for and hoping to find.
Oversized but still cute. Perfect for the weekend.

This sweater is a great, easy piece for every day. It runs a bit large, but fits pretty much how I expected an oversized sweater to fit. It is high quality, comfortable, and much prettier in person than in the pictures as there are threads of baby blue and orange woven throughout. As a lover of Elizabeth and James, this sweater did not disappoint.

links_reviews_title: Arrived with a noticeable faint stain on the left bottom corner so I didn't end up wearing it.
links_reviews_text: Oversized cozy fit good for the weekends with jeans or leggings and over the knee boots
Nice, oversized sweater. I loved the fit and never wanted to take it off. The stitching is stunning, and the wide sleeves provided an nice touch to a heavy sweater.

I was kind of hoping for a different fit, but I stilled loved it. It's so comfy and does gives that oversized look. I like things to be big on me so I usually size up for sweaters like this. Went with the Large and although I liked it, I don't think it looked as good on me (bigger boobs and broad shoulders) as it would on someone with a more petite upper body. Either way, it looked cute and was super comfy :)

This sweater was pretty oversized, but I suspected that based on other reviews. I didn't think it was itchy and just wore a long camisol underneath. I typically wear a medium and it fit without looking huge, but i think a small would've been better. I wore with leggings and the M was plenty long to cover my butt while wearing leggings, but I think the small probably would have too. I liked the wide sleeves and boxy look for everyday wear. I wore it on a 10 degree day without a coat for going in and out of the office and I was plenty warm. And the weather would likely be too thick to fit under a coat. I wish I would have snapped a photo!

Wore this with leggings to brunch on NYCs first really chilly weekend. It was PERFECT. So cozy, the colors of the pinks and blue came out nicely and was less beige bland that I was afraid of. I wish I could buy this.
Did not wear- too big and unflattering
True to size, very warm. Just a good, reliable sweater
Love how cozy it is

links_reviews_title: Sleeves too long and bulky to fit under my winter coat
links_reviews_text: Didn't end up wearing it

It runs large and if it fits large it is not a cute oversized look that you can sometimes get, it is a frumpy mess. but the color and material is amazing and if I could've gotten this in a medium it would've been the sweater for the fall with leggings and birks and a backpak YAS!
Runs large. If I sized down it would definitely still be oversized.

links_reviews_title: Very large however so on trend and AMAZING! I wish I could keep!
links_reviews_text: Very large however so on trend and AMAZING! I wish I could keep!
I wanted to love this sweater, as it sang "fall" and cozy to me, but ended up being too baggy and unflattering.

links_reviews_title: So comfy and warm. Great with leggings!
links_reviews_text: So comfy and warm. Great for a cool fall casual day.
Waist too small. Could barely button it. Loved the fit and look tho. I'll just get a bigger size next time

The pants have a great structure and make for a nice silhouette. I'm typically a 4 (UK8) but sized up to a UK12 based on reviews. I'm so glad I did. The pants were a tad big through the waist, but I don't think a smaller size would've worked through my butt and hips. With a shirt tucked in the waistline didn't look too big. They're gorgeous trousers. Loved them
Love everything about this pants. The waist fits perfectly. It is very flattering on the butt. Material feels great as well.

I am usually a 4 and rented as such but wow were they TINY in the waste. Sent them back and sized up 2 sizes and loved them! Felt super fashionable at work and got so many compliments. Glad I sized up! Will definitely rent again.

The waist is a bit too high (more of an empire waist), it's a tight fit around my rib cage, but comfortable enough to tuck in a shirt when they're actually sitting at my waist. I don't recommend on days you feel bloated - otherwise, super patriotic and comfortable material

links_reviews_title: Stylish cut - they are "baggier" so a fitted shirt helped to balance.
links_reviews_text: Red, White & Navy. Beautiful material.
I loved these, but they are very high waisted and very tight in the waist. Also a little shorter than I thought that they would be. Looked great with Sachin and Babi Midnight Vania top.

Thank goodness I read the reviews about sizing before I rented. They definitely run small, but with the help of the reviews, I rented the perfect size! They felt high quality, looked high fashion and got me a ton of compliments at work. Great way to add some fun to your work clothes.
A bit tight in the waist, wide in hips. Still wore them. I loved a casual look with a little style.
I wore these to a holiday party and got endless compliments. Very versatile pants with some extra flare. High waist and length were very flattering. Definitely recommend.

Fun pants, great fabric. I got a ton of compliments but at the end of the day was happy to return then since they're not comfortable to sit in. Very flattering for your butt though and fine in length for short gals!
I was tempted to buy these. Fabric is so high quality and you can tell they are well-made. I'm 5'2" and did not find these long at all. Glad I did one size up.

These pants give me curves! I dont have hips, but I do in these pants! I have short legs, so they were not a cropped pants for me. Very comfy! fit true size! I was walking in the West side, NY and someone came up to me, asked where I got them from. I was so proud to tell her "I rent them." Came home checked the price of these pants Holy xxxx! I would not buy these pants, LOVE the fact that I have a chance to wear them in Manhattan! Thanks RTR!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful but not perfect for short girls
links_reviews_text: Loved the design and feel of these pants. Unfortunately, I was too short for them so they were long like regular pants, but not long enough to wear 3+ inch heels, so I had to make due with shorter loafer style block heels. My personal opinion is that these probably look best if you are 5'5 and up. the positives were that I loved the fit (super high waisted) and how it accentuated my waist, although I do agree with other reviewers that they ran a bit small and were uncomfortable when sitting for a long time.

The pants fit perfectly and received a lot of complements. Note my waist size is a 26, and I'm 5'8" the pants were little longer than expected - little bit above my ankles. Usually paired better with a tuck in or crop top.
Absolutely love these pants! Received so many compliments! Wore these pants for both Work and weekend events. Highly recommend. Just make sure to size up 2 sizes since the pants run very small.

links_reviews_title: Definitely going to buy great fit wore size 0 American size 6 European super cut dressed up or down
links_reviews_text: Fit perfect on my waste! Perfect for a San Diego evening dinner rehearsal

Thick material, sits at the waist - recommend sizing up (usually a 4/6 if sitting at the waist, wore an 8 - 6 would've been best). I'm 5'4" and length was a little odd but I cuffed the bottoms. Would rent again.

These pants were amazing. I'm short so they were full length on me but perfect with small wedges. The waist was fitted perfectly and hit at the most flattering spot. Wore it with a cropped top and got tons of compliments. Can dress up or down!
These fit great. They were long but worn with a high wedge. Great quality fabric. Great to wear to work. Will rent again
I went with a size 2 but a size 0 would have fit perfectly. I'm pear shaped so high waisted pants can be tricky. I wore them and they were still a great pair of pants, thick and structured.
These pants are absolutely perfect. Not-too-heavy material but substantial nonetheless. High waist and wide legs are so stylish. I wish I could keep them forever!
These pants are frankly life!! I was obsessed with them! They run small so size up, and they are perfect for a more hourglass shape. They made me look so tiny which I loved. Tons of compliments!

Very stylish. I was worried it may be too long for me but it still looked fabulous as longer pants. First time trying this style and I fell in love now! Everybody noticed me wherever I went in these pants and I got tons of compliments.
Loved these! They were perfect for travel and the material doesn't itch or wrinkle much.
Runs small, but very stylish. You'll feel like a queen.

I could wear these And I have a small waist, hourglass shape, but they are proportioned oddly. If the waist was 1/2 inch bigger it would work Much better. The legs are slack like suit like and again they were cute but seriously size up, they are UK sizing so my 8 is a US 4/6. Usually perfect but not with these. The next size up would fit better in waist but possibly look old man pimp suit like(?)?

Loved these. I have never worn anything quite like this cut, but I loved it. The 8 fit me well and I am normally a 2/4. I have fuller hips and thighs for my size and a pretty small waist. I likely could have gotten away with wearing a 6, but the 8 was truly a perfectly comfortable fit. I'm about 5'7" and I kind of wish they were a smidge shorter. The fabric is a bit heavy, kind of like suiting material. Nonetheless, definitely 5 Stars! I still have them and will likely wear them to work next week.
Gives a very defined high waist and hits right at the ankle. Great thick material and coloring. Classy and chic!

links_reviews_title: Really cute, tight in the tummy
links_reviews_text: My only qualm with this pant is that in order to button it fully I had to pull it up so far I gave myself a little frontal wedgie - ouchie! I think the non-petite version would've been better for me, but I'm only 5'3" so who knows?! Really nice material though - well made! @chantel.alyssa

Thanks to other RTR reviewers I sized up for this pants and they fit just right. I was glad I read the reviews before renting it. They're supposed to be cropped pants so they fit my petite body like regular pants which is amazing because I always struggle with pants being too long. The fabric is thick but comfortable, only wished it had pockets but it's alright. I wore them with a red crop top since they are high waisted and wore them to work.
Cute pants, thick material

These pants have the tiniest waist. I previously thought I had the tiniest waist, but boy did these pants change my perspective. I sized up two sizes, and they are so cool. They fit perfectly and are ideal for work OR dinner

The pants are show stoppers! They run small and the high waist came up well over my belly button. I paired the pants with a rented sweather and wore the outfit to a golf tournament, work and out with friends. You won't regret this rent, but size up 1 ( or 2)
Runs small im usually a 4 but were amazing and a showstopper can dress up of down

I was so glad I took a chance on these pants. Hourglasses and pears will love them. Really emphasizes the waist to booty ratio. Im 5'3 so they're floor length. For work I wore them with suede pointy toe flats. Easy to dress up with a simple heeled sandal/pumps and a sexy top.

These pants made me feel instantly cool. Wore them out to work and after for dinner and a night out in town. Got compliments all day/night long. Negatives: They are longer than what they appear to be on the model and not too comfortable when you are sitting down for long.

links_reviews_title: Good length for petites, but impossible waist.
links_reviews_text: Love the material of these trousers (they move like a dream), and the stripes are super flattering (plus they make a statement). I'm 5' and these were great with a 3" heel. HOWEVER, the waist is abnormally tiny. I rented a 0 and couldnt comfortable clasp the waist (i iused a hairpin to get the pants to close. If I'd gone up in size though, they woukd have been way too big. And I'm SMALL (holding my daughter for reference). I'd prbably rent them again just because everything else was perfect, but unfortunately could never justify purchasing them.

These pants are super cute and have a great retro vibe to them. The material is pretty thick and feels very nice. I was concerned when pulling them up that they may not accomodate my (kinda large) butt, however they were great! Excellent pants for women on the old big butt/small waist struggle bus.

I wore these for two evenings out: Friday night sushi & cocktails with a girlfriend and for a holiday design event in Denver. I wasn't sure about these pants when I first put them on but quickly grew obsessed! These pants are so chic and fun. I wore them with a black turtleneck that I knotted in the middle to give my waist definition (which I think is a must in these pants) and wore with heels and heeled black booties. At the design party, an award event for the top architects and designers in Denver, I got a TON of compliments. One guy even told me, "Your. Pants. Are. Everything!"

I absolutely loved this dress. The color was gorgeous, the length was perfect, it fit my body well even given the dress' boxiness. I'd say it runs true to size. I had to get a size up cause it was all that was available and I think I could have managed my normal size but this still fit great! Highly recommend!!!

Loved the color for a summer work dress. I felt that it was a bit snug in the hip and bust region, but didn't stop me from wearing. The material felt a bit like neoprene so it was cumbersome to move around at times but it was a gorgeous color and you could rock some fun accessories with this dress.

I rented this for work. The dress is cute but I didn't find it too flattering on my figure. It is very boxy/straight and loose through the waist, which may not work well on hourglass/athletic figures like mine. PS - it doesn't run small but it does run on U.K. sizing, so it's be 2 sizes bigger than your US size
Pretty Dress but I chose to send back and not rent only because the material was too heavy for a Spring wedding.

I rented for a photo shoot. I sized up because VB dresses normally run small and I still had a few holiday pounds to shed but I went up two sizes to large. I still wore it underneath a coat and clipped it in the back with clips so it worked out

links_reviews_title: I wore this to my church choir. Very pretty flattering
links_reviews_text: The fit is not boxy at all and the ruffle flounces at the bottom made the dress, and it was pink . Invisible zipper. I'm not a huge I can see your zipper dresses. Beautiful dress , but I got no photos to share.
This beautiful purple dress was such a fun work dress, but would be great for day time weddings, church events, or showers. Fit TTS and looked polished and stylish.

links_reviews_title: Wore to conference, had to be comfortable from morning through dinner...perfect choice.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful color and material..loved this simple, classic dress
love this dress, great color, great quality, definitely a little baggier in the middle but its still flattering and its nice to have a cute dress that isnt skin tight sometimes!

links_reviews_title: Way too big and couldn't wear.
links_reviews_text: Material is very heavy and it is very large.

Larger chests may want to size up - the armholes fit me and my flat chest well, and I imagine a larger bust may be tight in the arms. The dress is a beautiful color and has a cute super-femme flounce in front - it is also forgiving for rounder tummies like mine! It is a lightweight semi-scuba/woolen material - wasn't too hot on a summer day - but it does wrinkle pretty easily. After a few hours at the office, the front and back were quite wrinkled from sitting.
The waist is very high and small, and was super tight. Very uncomfortable to wear. The fabric was very thin and light. I did really like the gold thread in the plaid.

links_reviews_title: "You look like if Maggie Rogers had to go to work"
links_reviews_text: ^actual compliment I received from someone. Beware they're super light even tho the pattern suggests fall/winter. Knocked off a star bc the gold threads make it kinda itchy

links_reviews_title: Trendy Print and Wide Leg Fit, Great for Petites
links_reviews_text: Great pants for petites! A small waist & perfect length. I typically wear 00 so they probably run one size small for most. Loved the trendy pattern. Dressed it with both a black long sleeve top/leather jacket and black booties for an edgy look, and a cream cashmere top with cream colored booties for a style that my husband called “70s London street vibes” haha! Minus one star because I felt the fabric quality wasn’t as nice as it should have been given the retail price.
For pants to accessories with

Giving these a 4 instead of 5 stars only due to the fact that they run a bit small. Others had commented but even sizing up I changed out of these before flying home for a meeting as I did not want to be uncomfortable. However, I loved the cropped length and the gold thread running through the plaid was such a great +1 detail. Would definitely recommend.

There is a thread of gold that runs through the plaid. Beautiful! The fabric is light and moves elegantly. The pleating is flat across the front and folds over to hide the pockets. I felt I could have sized down.

links_reviews_title: Perfect item for Unlimited - fun to have for a little while but no need to own.
links_reviews_text: I agree with other reviewers that this fabric is lightweight, has a metallic thread running through it and doesn’t have a particularly high-end look to it. But, they can definitely be styled in different directions and they’d be perfect for certain occasions. I’d say these pants more “edgy suburban” than “cool urban”. They are flowy and comfortable and would be perfect for a work dinner where you wanted to break out a bit but still be professional/conservative. More New England or Southern than LA or SF.
Easy to dress for work or for a night out. Material doesn't stretch

links_reviews_title: Great looking pants with a bit of sparkle. Diva meets county.
links_reviews_text: I do wish they fit I was super excited to wear them. They are thinner than I expected. Great looking.

links_reviews_title: Tried 2 different sizes but could not get to fit in the waist.
links_reviews_text: Super cute but both my usual (2) and sized up (4) were way too small in the waist. A 6 would have been giant in the legs. Too bad since the style looks fantastic.

I wore pants to a work meeting and received SO many compliments. They were the perfect choice for an early morning flight, sitting all day and heading into a work dinner. They are very comfortable and while they did wrinkle a bit, others didn't notice because of the plaid pattern. I wore them with a chambray blouse, tied at the waist and booties and felt like a million bucks!

Wish the waist on these wasn't quite as nipped in as it was - didn't fit my waistline - everywhere else was perfect. I'm larger, now, than my profile - about 175lbs - and a regular size 12. But these would be fabulous to wear in a business casual setting or even a more formal one with a blazer. They are a lighter weight than they appear in pics - easier to wear than the assumed heavy plaid fabric.
Too small
The color is more blush toned than tan. Material is very thin and quite cheap feeling for the price. Liked that it had pockets. I tried to make this work but couldn't. Sent back unworn.

Runs small, so was very tight in the waist. Hated the metallic gold thread running through them which I couldn't tell the pants had from the pictures- but then I hate metallic thread in general, I think it's tacky, But I did wear them, and they were ok. Wouldn't rent again.

I wish I could have bought these. They are so comfy, and light so they breathe well, have some nice gold detail weaved into the checker lines and I got a ton of compliments. I paired this with an evergreen crew neck t, a longer brown duster and a metal gold belt. Also paired with a black cropped turtleneck sweater. I was worried about how my legs would fit but because the pants are wide throughout you really only need to consider your waist and high hip measurements. I may have been able to go a size smaller but liked the more relaxed, boho chic look.
I like these a lot but can't believe how expensive they are given that the material is very thin and not soft. I don't want to say itchy, but kind of coarse.
Really great cut wore To a fancy dinner with heels

It looks beautifully made. has a very subtle glitter in form of very few golden threads spread all over. I wore it with a cream or beige top and nude heels. Its very comfy and sits just right on the waist line. perfect for shorter women. for taller women the lenght might not look that great. Looks expensive .

links_reviews_title: These pants are adorable and comfortable.
links_reviews_text: Light and silky fabric. Thin.
Front pleats require flat abs; material too thin for cool temps

links_reviews_title: Beautiful retro look but super tight waist!
links_reviews_text: Beautiful retro look but super tight waist! Color of tan is a true camel. The dark part of the plaid is a dark olive. The light color Hs a little pink to it. It was really tough for me to to match anything to these. These are very thin fabric and have a metallic thread. Too wide in the legs to go up a size. Too tight in the waist to down a size. The weird fit and hard to match colors made these pants a no-go for me. Really cute though. Sad I couldn't wear them!

links_reviews_title: I loved these pants. Super comfortable & tons of compliments! Perfect for hosting dinner at mine.
links_reviews_text: These pants fit but the fastener was a little tricky--i think it was seen on weird so it kept coming into eat random times (not due to overeating, ha! Just out of nowhere). But the wide leg is great.
Good fit

Wore this awesome jean jacket to Nashville on a girls trip! Felt like a local lol! Love the fringe and detail. The jacket was thick and sturdy, it's also cropped which was flattering. So many compliments
A little long on the sleeves but exactly what I wanted
Honestly never felt cooler

links_reviews_title: Absolutely loved- perfect for an extra layer that will get noticed!
links_reviews_text: Ordered this for a trip out west and ended up keeping it for a week I loved it so much. Need to get the jeans to match soon! Giving it up is sooo hard!
Great jacket just right. So get a bigger size so you can move your arms more

Loved how it looked, it cut exactly where it should and was a fun jean jacket. The only complaint is the fabric is crazy stiff, making casually wearing throughout the day hard, also its heavier than traditional jean jackets so save for cooler weather.
Pretty top, ribbed and nice fabric, good for winter except for the short sleeves.
Love love love. I wore so many times and want to buy! Super cute tucked in or untucked. Dressed up for work or down for causal.

Fit very well and was a light material. I did notice by the end of the work day it felt a little stretched out. I wore with high waisted flare crop pants and wavy hair for a bit of a 70's look. Lots of compliments on the top throughout the day!
Stretchy soft material so it's form fitting without being tight
I was very skeptical bc it looked so small on the hanger that not only would it be too short but also too tight; it was neither! It stretched out well but also didn't cling.
90s vibes all the way. Feel like I may have actually owned this shirt in middle school. It's cool and different, soft but a little stretchy. Bright colors, great for spring and summer.

links_reviews_title: Colorful, fun! Great top for work!
links_reviews_text: Very cute, fun to wear and a great way to change up my usual all black wardrobe. Felt very comfortable all day!

Love this top! I returned it but immediately rented again for another outing with friends. It fits a slightly bunching in the sleeves but otherwise a cute print and fitted well elsewhere. Highly recommend! Might buy!
This is a great sweater! It's very light and soft. The colors are just gorgeous in person! I found it very flattering, and fun! I would definitely recommend!
I loved the colors and design but the one I got was very worn out - if you get one in better condition I think you will like this.

links_reviews_title: Cute transitional piece but flimsier than I anticipated
links_reviews_text: Chose for a work event (it nailed our nonprofit corporate colors) but the thinner-than-expected fabric caused it to bunch up and not sit well. Great cut & color but subpar fabric.

links_reviews_title: Nice way to add some color to my work look
links_reviews_text: I loved this shirt - fit was true to size and loved the color. Others mentioned that the shirt stretches throughout the day, which happened to me too. I noticed it the most in the stomach area, which honestly didn't bother me. There were a few holes in mine, but they weren't noticeable.
Fit was flattering - wore this to work and it was super cute.

I wore this for a casual night out and also to work. The fabric is super soft and comfortable and the colors are fun! It's like an adult version of the striped limited too and Gap sweaters I used to love.

I really liked this shirt. I thought it was cute and fun for a 30th birthday party that I went to. It is slightly see through, so the first time I wore it I had to put a cami underneath. Second time I wore it I used a skin colored bra and it looked better. Overall comfy and cute!

The colors of this top are great! I loved how it paired with jeans to look polished and pulled together, but not stuffy. I did think the size was a bit big on me. This shirt stretches a bunch, so it's really comfortable. However, mine would fold up a bit or bag under my arms, so it was not quite a perfect fit.
Great sweater for spring. Loved the slightly longer sleeves and fun stripes. It was fitted without being too tight and showing lumps and bumps - great for work.

links_reviews_title: Looks just like picture. Fits true to size
links_reviews_text: I rented this for work and it was nice. Looks just like the picture. Fits as expected.
Lightweight, great for the office (especially one with aggressive air conditioning). Flattering and stretchy

links_reviews_title: Retro fun! Perfect for a classic car show
links_reviews_text: Pros: True to size. Vibrant colors. It was like stepping back into the 1970s. Cons. My only criticism with this garment is that the pictures made the dark color look like it was black. In fact, it is navy blue. Had to change up the pants that I was wearing to white. It would be nice if Rtr actually described the garments in more detail in their notes.

links_reviews_title: Super cute shirt. light and comfy.
links_reviews_text: Con: the armpits are showing wear...

What a delightful sweater! This garment made me smile when I opened my bag - the colors are vibrant and the stripes just scream spring/summer. The knit is luxurious and soft but retains some structure because of the ribbing. I wore with white ankle jeans and white Chucks for day, changing into heeled sandals for after work drinks. I'll definitely rent this again, but will size down for a more flattering fit.

links_reviews_title: This sweater is fine but not awesome.
links_reviews_text: This sweater is a nice light-weight and vibrant colors. The fit was looser than I was expecting. I wore it twice; it was average.

links_reviews_title: Nice but fabric a little flimsy
links_reviews_text: Fit cute but a little thin
More pastel than shown. Feels baggy and hits funny at the hip.
The colors are nice and the ribbed knit was flattering for my waist. However, it was thinner than expected. Fine basic item.
This is ribbed, so it fits fairly close to the body (and looks small until you put it on). Fabric is light and colors are bright - perfect for spring. Pair with wide-leg denim for a casual lewk!
The fit was loose and not as tight and fitted as I expected. The material is very thin. I love the colors on the shirt
This top is pure joy. The fit is very flattering and the colors are so bright and delightful. It can be polished up for work, or worn casually.

Runs large for sure, but the knit is fine and warm. Sleeve length hits right above the elbow. Beautiful colors and a great transition piece for these last few cold weeks of winter before spring really pops.
Sweater is comfortable and flattering. The one I received was new and the neck was a bit tight but that improved

Felt like I should be cast in Ladybird or a Delia's catalogue w this style. Cute but the sleeves were a little odd (maybe from hanger poking in oddly) so I ended up cuffing /rolling them up a little bit. Liked but it was fairly ordinary! Thin, rubbed cotton material.

links_reviews_title: Pretty colors, soft fabric...not a knockout but nice for every day wear
links_reviews_text: This top fits as it looks like in the photos. It's a conservative cut and print. The ribbed fabric is light and soft and looked cute with jeans and flats. The hues were more pastel-y than they appeared to me in the photo, and I didn't love that. While the fabric was comfy, it got a little saggy with wear and while I felt like I was wearing something new, it didn't feel special. There is a Tory Burch Sport top on RTR that has a similar cut and style but the fabric feels much higher quality and the colors are more vibrant. It was fine for when I wore it but I won't be renting it again.
Love the material and colors, great everyday piece that brightens up my wardrobe!
Love this shirt. So cute!
I loved the pattern and material. However it was a little short and too wide. Too boxy to wear on its own but is a nice piece to layer.

links_reviews_title: A Ride On The Leopard Print Train
links_reviews_text: Loved the fit, luscious silk fabric & did I mention LEOPARD PRINT? The keyhole at neck was fine for work, not too low at all. Elevated my mismatched black work separates to greatness.

links_reviews_title: Ok, but I wanted to love
links_reviews_text: This top doesn't have any stretch and fit just over my hips. It trended to ride up and didn't quite fit in the busy. Probably better for those that aren't super busty.. Loved the print.
I love this shirt. Beautiful quality and draping. Cut out is stylish but modest. It was a little big but still wearable.
Fit perfectly and such a cute pattern

links_reviews_title: I wore this top as much as possible - it fit and looked great!
links_reviews_text: Great top! Looks great on its own or under a blazer.

links_reviews_title: Wore this to dinner w a leather jacket and it was great!!

links_reviews_text: Well made and flattering. It is a bit short so no tucking needed, hit right at the top of my pants. Very nice fabric.

links_reviews_title: Classy way to get in on the leopard trend.
links_reviews_text: This top is perfection. It's a classy way to try out the leopard trend. It looks great casual or with work wear - I wore it both ways, with white jeans, black jeans, blue jeans, black pencil skirt, etc. It looked great with everything and fit true to size.
Nice professional look that can dress up or down.
This blouse was overall very cute. I wish it was a tad longer. The fabric is very lightweight. Not cheap, just lightweight. I'd rent again.
The collar on this top is very demure, not a 'cool' leopard top. It looks best for work with a black blazer. It's also in the short side.

links_reviews_title: Neutral goes well with other neutrals. Work to cocktail
links_reviews_text: The keyhole in front hangs a little low for me to wear to work. I'm 5'4"
The keyhole was a bit revealing and the shirt ran short. It was ok
Didn't fit right in chest area- to tight& loose everywhere else,& fabric was clingy
Great piece for a work conference-comfortable yet sharp look.
Such a fun cardigan. The pattern makes such a statement. This can be worn as a sweater, jacket, or cardigan. I loved it so much I had to buy it.
Fit well, was surprisingly warm. Here in Alabama we have warm winters with a few cold snaps. So this was perfect!

links_reviews_title: More like a Sweater than jacket
links_reviews_text: Super cute long cardigan sweater/duster! Would rent again! Fit perfectly over a sweater and jeans.

CONS: Was expecting this to be a coat but it's more like a cardigan. Material is on the thin side and it pills easily. PROS: Love the pattern, length and fit. And it has pockets! Great for a chilly day when you need layers.

links_reviews_title: So so so cute but a little itchy.
links_reviews_text: This looked SO cute on. Paired over a black t shirt dress with booties. However, it was quite itchy which was a total bummer because otherwise I'd probably buy!
I'm 5'5", size 12 pants, normally size medium top, and the Large fit perfect. I did not find it itchy at all like many other people did, maybe the one I was sent has been washed a lot. Love this.
Very warm. Sleeves were a little tight for fitting over a button up. Beautiful piece wonderful for cold office days. Would probably order a S next time.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a more casual work look
links_reviews_text: It's going to be rainy and cold tomorrow and I don't have any big meetings that I have to dress up for. I'm going to wear this and be warm and comfortable!
This sweater is so much fun! Perfect to keep you cozy for the warm months. It is a little itchy if you have bare arms underneath, but a quick fix is to wear long sleeves and you are all set!

This was a really nice piece. I rented this during COVID quarantine to wear for at home conference calls so I could be comfortable, and cute. While I liked the sweater, I ultimately would have enjoyed this more if I had been able to wear it outside as a transitional sweater/jacket.
Didn't want to give this back! Wore it to work and on the weekend.
Lightweight, easy to dress up it down, got tons of compliments.
I loved this cardigan!!! It looks awesome with a T-shirt and jeans and really pulled the outfit together
Was warm. Thought it would be too long but wasn't
True to size. Slightly short arms. Great length. Fit well. Loved the graphic print.
Loved this sweater! It was warm, comfortable, yet fun. The print is different and adds a little flare
Fits just like a sweater coat
I could feel it scratch through my shirt. Was real itchy.

links_reviews_title: Great sweater coat! It instantly added style to my simple mom uniform of black top and jeans
links_reviews_text: Nice thick knit with gorgeous details. Not itchy. Good fit for layering over items without looking bulky/boxy.
It was a tad adult contemporary for my taste, but beautifully made. Love the length and pockets.

I could wear this to work on a cold day, to the gym, to family dinners ... it's a really versatile piece. Note that it's designed to keep you warm and toasty, so if you perspire a lot it might not be right for you. I loved the texture, pattern, perfectly placed pockets ... I considered buying it but the one I rented showed signs of wear and I just couldn't justify paying $100 for something that looked so worn. A little disappointed in the quality, but it's probably honestly only something the person wearing it would notice

I wore this for Thanksgiving Dinner, a holiday party, brunch with friends and to work more than once. I received compliments on the pattern and likes the weight: warm but not to bulky. I would have purchased but the fabric was showing a tad bit of wear. Will definitely rent again!
Fit perfectly, looked great, was in great condition. Fun to add something new to my wardrobe for my trip.
Love the look of this cardigan, however the sleeves are a little short and it goes get pretty itchy since it's wool. But looks amazing!

I wore this cardigan on top of a dress for a work event in Chicago. This thing is so damn cozy, soft, and still very stylish. I received a ton of compliments. Will rent again, this could also easily be worn more casually

links_reviews_title: Love the graphic, but neutral print!
links_reviews_text: I ended up wearing this cardi multiple days in a row I liked it so much! Went well with most of my casual wardrobe and made basics feel more interesting. The only reason it gets 4 stars is that it's just a tad on the itchy side. I'd rent again!
Cute and great for lounging around the house. Super comfy!
This was a great sweater to hold me over in the New England winter to spring transition. Warm but lightweight
na

Love this sweater! It was my first RTR item and I was very impressed. Received several compliments. Wore it to work and all weekend :) I paired it with black pants, white shirt, and moto boots. Only con is that this sweater was itchy, which is the only reason I didn't purchase it for my closet. I'll be renting this again.

links_reviews_title: Fun sweater for work or everyday!
links_reviews_text: Loved this sweater! I wore it with work attire and also with jeans and a casual linen jumper. It has a fun, statement design but you can also throw it on with almost anything. It does show a little wear but it was comfortable and versatile-- I'd totally rent it again.

links_reviews_title: Warning: People will try to steal this off your back!
links_reviews_text: No joke, a woman at my posh little salon semi-jokingly tried to swap me her (also very awesome) sweater coat. It's a really special piece - easy to wear but not boring. Takes a basic black outfit to the next level. Pieces like this are the reason for having RTR Unlimited in my mind. I would keep it if it was just a little less worn... Absolutely presentable but starting too show the effects of multiple dry cleanings.

This was the perfect sweater to wear to work on a cold day. It kept me warm and was fashionable. So cute! Would love this even more if it wasn't so itchy. I wore a short sleeved shirt underneath and the part of my arms that was touching the sweater was very itchy. Easy solution, wear a long sleeved shirt!

I loved the pattern in this sweater; bold enough that I wore all black underneath most of the time. The sweater is unbelievably comfortable and warm: perfect for MN winter! My only complaint is that it was slightly itchy, but the pockets were soft and lovely, so I wasn't too bothered.

links_reviews_title: Wore it to a surprise birthday party
links_reviews_text: It ran true to size and was warm and classy. I would rent this again.

links_reviews_title: Great everyday piece that can be dressed up or down.
links_reviews_text: Flattering and chic. Material slightly scratchy/itchy.
Nice and comfortable Sweater. It kept me warm on some cold days. One little con is it was worn looking among the threads on the sleeve.
Wore it over black dress. Very impactful black and white design. Runs big. Perfect for cozy look during the winter
nice pattern and very warm. good for winter maternity.

The pants were thinner than I expected them to be. Once I put them on the pattern stretched out and lost the deep hue. They looked faded. I also rented the matching top so there was a clear contrast. I think is better suited for someone who is leaner and any stretch in this fabric would lead to the faded look.

These fit well and mostly stayed in place during my 3 mile run but I'm kinda just ok with them. They get a tiny bit see through and pinch a funny point in my hips. Funky and cute but just alright for me.
They are just leggings. Nothing special...

links_reviews_title: obsessed with the head turning print
links_reviews_text: They are buttery soft, super cute, and demand a lot of attention. The only downfall is that they sort of lose the pattern a bit where they stretch too far (the color looks muted and stretched) so if you have a big behind or bigger than average curves, size up!
True to size. Loved dual pockets. Color super fun to brighten dull winters
Knew it would be short and boxy going into it... just didn't expect to swim in the jacket. It's really big.
A cherry red winter jacket. Was nice for a winter roadtrip.

Definitely size down! I ordered a size down at 8 months pregnant with room to spare. The color is the real standout; it was the perfect holiday coat. The cut isn't the most flattering, but it worked with more fitted outfits. I received a lot of compliments on this coat.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful but very boxy, big cut
links_reviews_text: I loved the color and was super excited to wear this to brighten up winter days. However, the cut is super boxy and it seemed to run large on top of that. I have worn J.Crew wool jackets for years and the large in this coat made me feel like I was drowning in it and actually made it hard to wear. If you are between sizes I would consider sizing down.
Warm jacket but hard to match. It's a reddish pink. not all the way red and not really pink
It’s a bit heavy but I liked color and spacious. It keeps me warm in a chilly day and night.
Fits big and boxy. Warm and loved the color. More of a pink red

I was looking for a cute coat I could rent for the Fall season to add a pop of color to my wardrobe and came across this. The quality of the coat is gorgeous, as with all J.Crew wool coats, but I hate the styling on this. The sleeves are a drop shoulder on a very heavy material so they don't drape well and the whole body is boxy and oversized. The pockets on the front are also huge and don't bend well with the coat. I honestly looked like a giant pink marshmallow when I put this on. I would HIGHLY recommend to size down if you are interested in this jacket to get a better look.

links_reviews_title: I loved this dress, perfect color!
links_reviews_text: It's short but it's so cute with snakeskin booties!

links_reviews_title: This dress made my legs look long and was a very flattering style!
links_reviews_text: The fit was purposefully loose, but in a good way. It really highlights the legs for girls, like me, with long pins! It's got a 1960s vibe and goes great with a pair of heels. The colour doesn't look great on the hanger but looks wonderful on.
Cute dress to work to work or even after work.
Fits overall but short and needed tights. I'm 5'3", so i was surprised it was so short for a large!
I received many compliments wearing this dress. The fit was perfect. The material, color, style was amazing! It was hard for me to say goodbye to this dress.

The fabric wrinkles easily but not in a very obvious way. The color will suits better on very pale or tanned skin. My friend saw me in dress and called me fashion-forward and very "Yeezy". I agree that this dress is very simple and has a hint of sporty/fancy twist in it. Love it !!!

I love everything about this dress! The color is a beautiful warm yellow, not crazy bright. The material is great quality, a little thicker than expected but it's breathable. And the dress fits really well. Might buy this!
Flattering fit. Has silver buttons in the back.

links_reviews_title: Great dress for work, lots of compliments.
links_reviews_text: Nice, thick fabric. I was worried that it would be too hot for summer, but was still nice for the office; received lots of compliments both times I wore it!

links_reviews_title: So easy and classy at the same time!
links_reviews_text: Endless compliments on this one. Such a buttery almost faded apricot color, nice easy lose fit but short enough to keep it from making me shapeless.
Loved - intentionally oversized look. Great sleeve!

I rented this for an engagement party and it was perfect! The material was much different than I had expected but it made the dress look much nicer than I initially thought it was going to be! Beautiful color and dress. I received compliments all night!

I wore this dress to dinner and theater tonight and I cannot count the complements received from complete strangers, men and women. The dress is very "of the moment" with its statement sleeve, yet has the timeless appeal and comfort of a classic shift. The color is luscious and the weight and sheen of the fabric add to the overall appeal. Perfect drape, touch of stretch. Interesting buttons at back neck closure. I would love to own this dress, will wear again.
the perfect dress. awesome material, great color, just the right 'oversized' fit.

The dress was a high quality material and a nice color. It was an appropriate length for work but it was not flattering and was pulling at it all day because the collar felt like it was choking me all day. That was the worst part and would not rent again because of that.
Loved the size of the sleeves and the golden color. It's short, I'm very short and still felt short on me with tights but I loved it!
I wore this black tights and boots and it was so cute. My husband loved it!

I LOVED the color and fit of this dress - definitely true to size and fit everywhere except ... it was too short to wear anywhere. I'm only 5'6 - I do have a long torso, but this was so short I had to return it :(

I don't know if this has shrunk over time but the dress I received was laughably short. It covered just my butt and looked more like a long tunic. I'm not even that tall at 5'4. I wore with leggings which wasn't my favorite look.

Wow this dress is SHORT! I'm 5'0 on a good day and it looked indecent on me. I'm not sure if this dress should be marketed as a dress. I can't imagine anyone being able to wear this without tights especially because of the fit of this dress. Imagine wearing an oversized sweater with no pants

links_reviews_title: Very heavy fabric; not for summer wear.
links_reviews_text: Way too short! Barely covered my (small) bum.

links_reviews_title: Great color and interesting heavy material. Length- WAY too short. Collar chokes you and pulls back.
links_reviews_text: Really enjoyed this dress, but had to wear leggings underneath. The dress was a great fit everywhere, even a little big except for the length and the neck. Definitely inappropriate for work, too short to wear out socially even with flats, etc. Why is this dress so short? Also the neckline chokes you somehow.
Fit was okay, but incredibly short! Not appropriate to leave the house. Also, the material was much thicker than I anticipated and just didn't fit the shortness...
Runs short but so cute, gorgeous color. Wore to work and out after. So many compliments. Flattering shape.
even on platinum blondes. fit is tts, especially for tibi. buttons in back make this dress fun.
This dress was rented for work but was WAY too short so I wore on the weekend. It would be too short for anyone that is not petite but it is a perfect spring dress for a short frame!

links_reviews_title: Rented for work, but unfortunately way too short.
links_reviews_text: The color, cut, and material of this dress are all winners however it was SO SO SHORT. I'm only 5'6 and this barely fell below my panty line. Definitely a no for work and honestly too short for anything else either, probably a better fit for petites.

links_reviews_title: I loved the color. I wore it with leggings because it was a little too short for work.
links_reviews_text: Great fit just a little short
Flowed nicely.

Wasn't my favorite. I'm 5'2 and could not have worn this dress without tights. It was VERY short. The neckline was also uncomfortable, constantly riding up. Wouldn't rent again, even though the color is beautiful.

So nice. The buttery color is soft and flattering. The puff in the sleeves is fun. The length was a couple inches higher than I would have liked in the workplace, but maybe it was my paranoia. There is a bit of room overall, so stay true to size.

links_reviews_title: Photos do not do this dress justice.
links_reviews_text: The fit is perfect. It was a little shorter on than it appears to be in photos. The fit is actually very flattering. The boxy look it has in pictures was not the actual outcome I experienced. it came in just slightly (not tight) at the waist which was perfect.

For the heavy weave fabric that it is, it is not forgiving and translucent. I wore it with brown stretch pants and my brown boots. You could still see my panty lines and the bra under a tank top. Spanx are a must! Other than that, it is comfortable, and great for the office.

As other reviews have noted, this dress is SHORT! So short that I actually had to wear pants with it. Tights weren't good enough. It's really tunic length. I'm only 5'6", so I can't imagine this on anyone taller. Loved the color and the sleeves. It just needed to be longer. It also a knit so it shows a lot of bumps in the chest area.

This dress was perfect for a tropical bachelorette party! I wore it out and was so comfy. The material is really nice and the color is a very pretty muted yellow. I am glad I went with the medium as it fit perfectly. The length on me was mini without me having to worry about anything showing while dancing. Wish I had kept it!!
Got lots of compliments
Great color and got so many compliments! Fits great for someone on the shorter side. I am 5'3" and it was a great fit with sheer tights.

links_reviews_title: Rented it for a date night with hubby, loved wearing it.
links_reviews_text: Can see the lines through the dress- be careful with undergarment selection!

links_reviews_title: Comfortable and Cute Great quality thick fabric dress up or down fairly true to size, slightly big
links_reviews_text: I would have bought this but the one I received had a very light stain

links_reviews_title: Nice color, comfortable, and good quality but not enough shape for my body
links_reviews_text: Made me look heavy on top so wore casually on the weekend while shopping. Did not wear to work
I may be buying this one, sorry.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a trip to Europe
links_reviews_text: This top made me feel so glamorous while enjoying a summer day during vacation.

links_reviews_title: Cute top with an interesting twist
links_reviews_text: This was a really cute top for a casual day at work. It ran a teeny bit big in the shoulders for me and I needed to wear a cami underneath. Once I tied it in a bow, it looked nice and for better. Quick tip - make sure you iron it thoroughly before wearing to ensure it looks good.

links_reviews_title: Big but I kinda love it!
links_reviews_text: Hi all, I'm petite and the shirt can definitely feel a little bigger. It's not form fitting but I don't think it is meant to be. If you tie the tie tighter it helps, but overall I really do love it. It feels so comfortable and light weight, perfect for these hot summer days when you still have to dress for work.

Like many reviewers, I had to pin the front to keep it work appropriate. No big deal. I'll probably wear it on the weekend sans safety pin with white jeans. I love the unique style of this top & I can't wait to rent it in another color.

The blouse fit well but required a safety pin for the neckline. I felt I had to tie the pieces in the front in a knot as shown in my photo which sort of makes them look like a bow and makes the shirt more cute than sophisticated. When I simply crossed the two pieces like the photo of the model, they loosened up when I sat down or moved around. I enjoyed wearing the blouse twice, but it was a little high maintenance for me.

links_reviews_title: Cute top to pair with a work skirt
links_reviews_text: Really liked this too even if it is a little different! It paired well with a nice pencil skirt for work. True to size but I DEFINITELY needed a tank top under. I'm not sure how anyone could get away without a tank under this.
So many compliments. Loved the style. Figure flattering and comfortable, but a little large in the bust kept having to make sure my bra wasn't showing. But overall love and would rent again!

links_reviews_title: A little loose in the chest
links_reviews_text: True to size top that was cute to wear on a casual brewery night, but I did have to pin the top closed because I did not want to wear a camisole.
This is cute and works for a casual, professional workplace. However, the neckline is much deeper on me than I expected. Plan on wearing a cami.

links_reviews_title: Nice top, falls open a bit in front
links_reviews_text: Great top, good fabric and style- looked really crisp and summery w white jeans. Only issue was it felt like it kept coming open in the boob area. Maybe try some fashion tape. Not a total deal breaker though. I would rent it again.

Definitely one of my favorite rentals yet. This top is SO CUTE and the waist tie made it very flattering & adjustable ... it is low cut, so I wore a bralette underneath to keep it work appropriate. I'm not super blessed up top so I didn't have to worry about showing too much cleavage, although it could definitely be pinned shut if that is a concern. Received compliments from my coworkers (not an easily impressed bunch) over and over and over again. Would rent again in a heartbeat!

links_reviews_title: Stripped shirt that ties in the front
links_reviews_text: Cute top that I rented for work. A little awkward with the tie, wasn't sure how to tie it and it looked a little awkward so I tucked the ends into the knot. A little low cut so wore a cami under to make it work appropriate.

links_reviews_title: Wore for a party at my son's preschool
links_reviews_text: I wore this to a party at my son's school. I had to wear a cami underneath because it was a little lower than I like. Overall I thought it fit a little large in the chest (I'm a B cup) and probably could have sized down but worked fine in the medium too.
Very comfy top. Any cup size can wear this. Can be dressed up or down.
Lovely top for work or casual events. I wore it with a cami as the top can be quite open at times. Quality fabric and lightweight which made it great for packing.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for jeans. Wear it untucked, unless with a highwaist
links_reviews_text: If you order a size down (I'm normally a medium - 34D) it eliminates the gapping issues described in other reviews.
I wanted to love this, but even the medium was a little too big, and I am not a small person. The tie front kept coming undone, and it made the front gap in a rather salacious way.

links_reviews_title: Cute shirt! Love the bow detail! Little low in the front and had to pin it.
links_reviews_text: Wore with white shorts, felt it was cute. Little low, but liked it.
Super flattering fit.
Low cut needed a tank under

Picked for a casual Friday at work. Ordered a size smaller and I'm glad I did. Definitely has a unique style and would recommend it to those that are flexible vs. practical when it comes to style. Had to use some fashion tape for this one. Otherwise cute and different

True to size fit cotton top has an interesting twist with front tie. The colors are light blue, pink and white. Worked nicely with light denim. I did have to pin it so it wouldn't open when I moved. The cinched waist provides a flattering silhouette. Comfortable to wear and perfect for summer.
I loved the look of this but required constant adjustment because of how low it plunged (I am 5'0")

Pros: cute design, comfortable, hides postpartum belly (would also work for accommodating a baby bump) Cons: really requires wearing a camisole underneath. The top is low cut and gaped badly if I sat down or slouched. There was no good way to safety pin it shut. Such a shame.
Way too low cut - tried to wear it to class but was pulling up my shirt every 20 minutes - I am usually not an XS but ordered a smaller size as it seemed to run big - even too big for me!
Good daytime top. Looks great w/ jeans
perfect fit- my style
I got this to go with jeans for work. It's a pretty shirt but definitely needed to safety pin the v neck together. Otherwise I'd look down and my bra would be showing.
I thought I might like to try this blouse with the BIG tie in front. however, it was way too large for my body type.

links_reviews_title: Loved the concept. But not executed where it was easy to wear
links_reviews_text: I originally got this as a work top. The top is super low cut. Doesn't say tied. I assumed it was only supposed to tie once bc twice takes away the look of how it looked on the model. Kept coming undone. No hook and eye to help close the front. Was a very difficult too to wear all day. Disappointed

links_reviews_title: I wore this for a gender reveal party and it definitely fit the occasion.
links_reviews_text: Looks like a hospital top when you get it, but being able to tie it at the waist, made it fit nicely.
I love this shirt. It is very cute and can be worn casual or dressed up.
The top doesn't really wrap around and left a gap in the middle.
It was perfect. Might want to wear a camisole with it.
Fit so strangely (too big at the shoulders, too small in the boobs). Probably would work with a smaller cup size but definitely couldn't wear this to work
Not a great fit.
Really low cut. Super cute but you have to constantly keep tying it so that's a bit annoying. But would wear again.

links_reviews_title: very cute, different top big tie in the front.
links_reviews_text: usually wear a medium and ordered a small, it was perfect.
Runs a little bit large, I have a larger bust so I wore a came underneath but still felt appropriately covered and very cute!

links_reviews_title: as my friends said, i looked "snatched"!
links_reviews_text: this top was great to wear in the winter! heavy good quality fabric kept me in place and supported. wish i could keep this!

links_reviews_title: Casual checked shirt : becoming and tailored enough
links_reviews_text: This top was a bit worn but fun to wear. Practical and got compliments. Tied in front because I felt the back row was dated. And front was more appropriate for my figure. Stylish. Catchy. Great pattern.
This shirt is awesome. It fits like a glove. The quality is excellent (as it should be), and I just feel cute. Wish it wasn't so darn expensive, then I'd actually purchase it.
Great look with a pair of navy pants. A little hard to get into at first but great fit once you do. Good quality item.
Looks good tied in front or back.
Nice classic look paired with a navy pencil skirt. Cute but not wow.
Paired well with form fitting pencil skirt. Not an over the top wow but a decent look. I liked the slits on the side.
I was planning on wearing this top by itself, but I noticed the pink stripe in the plaid. Because I like mixed prints, I paired this top with the Pink Hannah top by Petersyn.
Super snug through the bust and shoulders, definitely not for those who are not slim in that area.
It was little small in the chest area. I layered it with a white button down, which added a little extra.

So cute with amazing structure. The fabric is thick (probably not great on a super hot, humid day) but really flattered my hourglass shape and made me feel awesome. Loved wearing, will definitely rent again.
Fit at the waist, but too big under the arms.

I am typically a size 12 in tops. Rented a size 48. Fit ok. Top has no stretch or give. It is incredibly thick and heavy. Not a good choice for summer. My issue with this shirt is the cut away at the arm pits. Instead of just going straight down the top goes in a little and made it look like I had arm pit fat which has never been an issue in other blouses.
So cute and comfy, perfect length, amazing for work. I tied it in the front for a different look. Wish I owned!

Rented this to wear for work meetings. I do t like my plaids boring so I paired it with black laced leather pants and neon yellow pumps. Once I threw a white boyfriend style blazer I was ready to conifer the fucking world. I've never felt more badass in a corporate environment. Plaidass. Yeah, I said it.
Great material. Very cute shirt. Wish i could afford to buy it. Would def rent again

links_reviews_title: Really nice shirt, but the armholes are enormous!
links_reviews_text: For me, it has everything going for it (style, fit, fabric quality, print, color), except for the armholes. They are so large I had to wear something underneath it (black t-shirt once and black tank top once) to make it wearable in public. Nonetheless, it was a nice shirt and I'd get it again.
Cute but felt overwhelming on my frame (I'm short but "curvy") and was super long. Couldn't figure out a way to wear it without feeling like I was wearing an art smock!
beautiful fabric

Loved this top... good fit that runs true to size and feels comfortable. I wore it to work with black pants but it can easily be dressed with jeans for casual days, or a more formal skirt for dinners and nights out.

links_reviews_title: Soft as butter and goes with everything
links_reviews_text: I kept this RTR Unlimited piece for almost two months. I hate to send to back! It traveled with me from Boston to San Francisco twice, and from the airport to the evenings, it was perfect. It's light enough that it's not a pain to carry. It folds up pretty small and flat.
